Solution on-sentence summary: Multi-Drain geothermal well for decarbonising district heating networks
Identification: Heating in buildings is at the core of energy consumption. Thus decarbonise energy sources is crucial to reduce associated emissions. Geothermal district heating is defined as the use of geothermal sources to supply heat to a group of buildings through a distribution network. The main benefits of geothermal sources are provision of local, and flexible renewable energy. Even though there are plenty of geothermal sedimentary reservoirs to use, there is sometimes heterogeneities of geological properties that limited productivity. The goal is then to optimise the draining area and thus to increase the overall energy extracted from the ground. This multidrains technology steps up the efficiency of a geothermal solution.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Credibility
Tags: Underground, Geothermal power, District heating & cooling, Drilling and extraction

Solution on-sentence summary: Affordable, compressed air and thermal energy storage at half the cost of lithium-ion
Identification: Cheesecake Energy’s eTanker is a stationary, medium-long-duration energy storage solution which delivers cheap, reliable, efficient energy storage in a modular, containerised package. ​ The technology stores energy in the form of heat and pressurised air, adapting ex-service truck engines with our patented modifications to become zero-emission electrical power-conversion machines for putting energy into storage and recovering it from storage. Our proprietary system architecture unlocks low-cost performance in a compact footprint that represents a step change in compressed air energy storage capabilities.​ The system is safe, straightforward to operate, has a lifetime of up to 25 years and can deliver turnaround efficiencies of 65-70%. ​​​ eTanker can discharge at full power for up to 20 hours at 30-40% lower cost than lithium-ion batteries and can be deployed flexibly as power and energy are scaled separately from one another.

Solution on-sentence summary: A water and energy saving toilet designed for out-of-home use
Identification: Propelair has one goal: saving the world’s water resources, with every flush. It is the world's lowest water usage flush toilet, specifically for commercial use. The average UK toilet uses 6-9 litres of water to flush. Propelair uses just 1.5 litres of water & displaced air technology to create a powerful, high-performance flush which easily removes all waste with 1 flush. Because less water is needed, its system reduces the carbon footprint of the average toilet by 80%. Propelair reduces water & sewage bills by up to 60%  while paying for itself in just 1-3 years. Additionaly, the Solution refills in 30 seconds, reducing queues. It can be retrofitted to existing drains, requiring little to no refurbishment prior to installation. It's robust design makes it well suited for corporate & commercial washrooms, reducing maintenance costs.

Solution on-sentence summary: An energy storage system for grid stabilization and EV charging stations
Identification: NW developed the JBox®, a battery-based energy storage system, to improve the efficiency of power management. It balances the electrical grid by charging when there is too much production and by injecting the electricity back when consumption is too important. A compact all-in-one device, the JBox is easy to install and to connect to the local distribution grid. The IECharge®, an electric vehicle charging station, is directly plugged to the solution. This enables the battery to release the pressure off the grid during the charge of a vehicle at great power - up to 320 kW. The project aims at creating a strong network of ultra-fast charging stations in order to develop the use of electric vehicles on long distances without having to worry about the autonomy.

Solution on-sentence summary: An energy-efficient electric motor technology for compressor and pumping applications
Identification: The Solution aims at enabling billions of homes, businesses and vehicles worldwide to lower significantly the environmental footprint of their compression, pumping, heating, cooling and refrigeration needs through the use of a new, ultra-high efficiency linear compressor and pump technology. The Solution relies on a disruptive new linear electric motor technology, the first of its kind to successfully use long-distance magnetic attraction and repulsion to deliver linear power in both directions at unprecedented levels of efficiency with characteristics that are perfectly suited to pumping and compression requirements. Oil-free, smaller and lighter, the Solution is a drop-in replacement to the dominant reciprocating-piston based technology, reducing manufacturing costs with fewer parts and less complexity as well as shorter and cheaper production and assembly lines. Finally, end users of the Solution will significantly lower their operating costs while benefiting from better products.

Solution on-sentence summary: A decentralized treatment solution for transforming organic waste into compost
Identification: Acea has launched Acea Smart Comp, an innovative distributed composting project for managing organic waste, in line with the challenging goals set by the European Commission regarding the recovery of materials during the process for "closing the loop" in the waste cycle. Acea Smart Comps are local composting plants equipped with revolutionary sensor technology that transforms organic waste into compost on the spot, using an aerobic process that produces ready-to-use fertilizer. This initiative creates a new approach focused on proximity, which closes the gap between where the waste is produced and the place where it is processed. Distributed composting targets large customers (shopping malls, cafeterias, airports and stations) that need to manage large quantities of organic waste. The first Acea Smart Comp was installed in the Acea cafeteria, which will become organic waste-free.

Solution on-sentence summary: A digital solution for cost-efficient and sustainable aircraft management
Identification:
Pacelab Flight Profile Optimizer is a portable EFB application which gives crews fully actionable recommendations on the most cost-efficient way to complete their flights under the current conditions, carefully balancing operational considerations with passenger comfort and on-time performance. It optimizes holistically all flight phases from climb to descent, relying on high-fidelity and real time data to deliver information that is accurate, relevant and complete. Is vertical flight optimization not enough? We have teamed up Nexteon Technologies to create and integrated, multi-dimensional optimization solution which combines lateral optimization capabilities with the vertical flight profile optimization of Pacelab FPO in a single, powerful system.

Solution on-sentence summary: A technology that transforms led lightnings into communication networks
Identification:
An electronic device placed between the power supply (or LED driver) of the luminaire and the light-diffusing electronic board, the QR-Light solution transforms lighting into a new instant communication network by modulating the LED light according to the optical Morse code principle several million times per second.



Associated with a mobile application, it enables the development of location-based services. This revolutionary technology can be used in a wide variety of applications, from hospitals to airports, government and transport utilities, museums, industrial areas, etc. In addition, it can also be an important digital tool for people with reduced mobility or disabilities to give them more autonomy in their freedom of movement, in an environmentally friendly approach. QR-Light significantly reduces the carbon footprint caused by the use of digital tools while increasing profitability and savings for producers, retailers, and consumers.

Solution on-sentence summary: A solar shading system to reduce energy consumption in commercial buildings
Identification:
Commercial buildings often have limited roof space for conventional solar panels. They also require shading devices for protection against the harsh summer sun.



The Solution generates solar energy, and it saves energy by reducing heating, cooling, and artificial lighting needs in commercial buildings. It is the Internet of Things (IoT) enabled and uses a sun-tracking algorithm with inputs from sensors and other data to optimize louvre slat position with minimum to no manual involvement. This allows louvres to be controlled individually, collectively, or per façade, while the stacking option can be utilised to maximise daylight, ventilation or to allow for window maintenance. It is a turn-key solution consisting of an array of double-sided photovoltaic slats installed in their frame onto a building façade, with dynamic slat control through the intelligent automation system. This is supported by an ongoing performance monitoring and maintenance service. Other than commercial buildings, the Solution is also suitable for industrial buildings, public buildings, and residential and agricultural markets. It could be installed horizontally or vertically, in front of windows, against  building façades, or as fencing/partitioning.

Solution on-sentence summary: A service that allows users to pay for cooling instead of purchasing entire systems
Identification: Cooling as a Service (CaaS) is an innovative business model that enables end-users to access clean and efficient cooling solutions without the need of an upfront investment. This servitization model addresses the key market barriers that hinder the adoption of sustainable cooling by allowing customers to pay for the service consumed, on a fixed-fee-per-unit basis. Meanwhile, the ownership of the system remains with the technology provider, who is responsible for all operation costs. Through its CaaS initiative, the Basel Agency for Sustainable Energy (BASE), with support from the Kigali Cooling Efficiency Program (K-CEP) and with the endorsement of the Global Innovation Lab for Climate Finance, has accelerated the adoption of the business model around the world in a variety of sectors and industries, from industrial refrigeration and commercial air-conditioning to agricultural and medical cold chains.

Solution on-sentence summary: A wastewater heat recovery system for individual showers
Identification: Currently, a lot of energy is wasted in the form of hot water. In fact, each shower only uses 15% of the calories contained in the hot water. When the water is ejected to the sewers, its average temperature is about 33°C for a standard shower at 38°C. This energy could be used to preheat the fresh clear water and reduce the energy needed. Moreover, the time waiting for hot water after the tap opening waste a lot of water. At each shower, 9 litres are lost during this phase. Gecko reuse 88% of the calories contains in the wastewater and provide hot water 3 seconds after the tap opening. By reducing the energy needed to warm the fresh clear water and reducing the waiting time for hot water, Gecko has a positive global impact.

Solution on-sentence summary: A device using motorized pumps to deliver hot water in 2 seconds to the taps, avoiding energy and water waste
Identification: The distribution of Domestic Hot Water (DHW) have many drawbacks. They are a source of discomfort, waste of water and energy, and a bacteriological risk. According to Enertech specialized in the energy performance of the building: “Between 35% and 60% heat of a domestic hot water production facility (DHW) is lost in the distribution, between the storage tank and the taps. Continuous operation loop distribution and widespread in apartment buildings are the main causes of these losses“. To tackle this challenge, the HotWaterQuickly delivers hot water instantly in less than 2 seconds to all taps. Indeed, in each building, a powerful motorized pump channels the hot water from the reserve, to inject it at high pressure (250 bars) into a very small section pipe (3.5mm diameter), which conducts the hot water at high speed (at nearly 100Km/h). This way, the water is provided very quickly into the customer taps.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Building heating
The environmental benefits: Hot water reaches the customer’s tap within 2 seconds;The HWQ process is 10 times more economical and environmentally friendly than a recirculation loop;DHW production can be reduced by up to 50% (800Kwh / hour / year) thus reducing CO2 emissions into the atmosphere by 10 tons per year for a residential building with 25 apartments;Allows to reduce the consumption of hot water up to 10 liters of water per day per person that will no longer be wasted waiting for hot water at the tap;
The Financial benefits: HWQ allows the user to save around 110 € / year / apartment;0-year payback period with an annual ROI of 18% in new buildings;

Solution on-sentence summary: A software solution to support sales representatives in the energy field during the lifecycle of a new renewable energy system
Identification:
Since the PV market and customer needs are changing, customer orientation is becoming a major issue in the energy industry. The Eturnity Solution is replacing the efficiency barriers and persuasion efforts with automated and simple, but precise advice.

It combines two digital tools: The Eturnity Calculator and Expert, each for the PV and heating sectors. This covers acquisition, consulting, planning, and sales of renewable energy systems.



The Eturnity Calculator takes on the role as the first filter. The end customer receives a simulation of their personal energy system and then obtains a custom overview according to their criteria, incl. graphics that are accurate, but not too technical. The installer then sees who is only obtaining initial information and who is planning a concrete project.

The Eturnity Expert reduces the effort by reducing the number of interfaces. The time savings to the point of quote creation is up to 80 %. Personnel capacities can, therefore, be used elsewhere.

Solution on-sentence summary: Small-scale hydrokinetic turbines that enable users to harness clean, predictable energy from water in rivers
Identification: The DesignPro Renewables hydrokinetic turbine harnesses the kinetic energy from flowing water found in rivers and estuaries. The unique concept of this device exploits the natural phenomenon that occurs when flowing water comes into contact with an object or obstruction. By using such an obstacle as part of our design, water is compressed and accelerates as it is diverted out and around the body. The compact design makes it simple and cost-effective to deploy without major civil works with installation times as short as 3 hours for a 25kW system. The device is floating and not permanently fixed so it can be moved easily if required. The platform gives access to the turbines, which can be lifted out of the water for maintenance without having to remove the device.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Rivers, Turbines, Hydropower
The environmental benefits: No head of water is needed to generate adequate power from the ambient flow, even in sites with 1.5 metres per second (mps) means that there is no need for expensive and disruptive civil works;A 25kW turbine can displace a 90kW diesel generator that requires 24/7 operation to provide power for 20-30 homes, the turbine would save 4,642 tonnes of CO2;Efficiently capture kinetic energy of water flows ( 2M/S),  opening up viable deployment opportunities in a greater range of water flows ;

Solution on-sentence summary: Thermoplastic honeycomb cores from recycled polyethylene terephthalate
Identification: Sandwich panels are a very efficient structures, delivering high level of mechanical performance at extremely low weight and are being used in a wide range of applications. Amongst them, honeycomb has been the most efficient in terms of mechanical performance to weight ratio. Recycled honeycomb cores is seeking for replacement of foam cores and the total addressable market for RPET honeycomb is very large. EconCore has developed a continuous manufacturing process that can produce thermoformable, high-performance panels with a thermoplastic core made out of 95 % of recycled PET, in a cost-effective way. This recycling of plastic bottles is an important step forward in the pursuit of sustainability, as waste can be converted into performance-to-weight-optimized honeycomb structures. With the RPET honeycomb core, EconCore sees opportunities in many applications such as the automotive market where weight reduction becomes crucial to reduce CO2 emissions with sustainable resources and lightweight cost-efficient solutions. Also, other markets, including industrial packaging and transportation, have interesting applications where this material can be an excellent fit. The use of RPET honeycomb cores gives a sustainable solution with a good Life Cycle Assessment and low carbon footprint which fits the world-wide sustainability strategy.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

Solution on-sentence summary: Revenue and flow metering for potable water distribution networks and irrigation applications
Identification: The purpose of a potable water distribution network is to supply users with water with adequate pressure under various loading conditions. Water utilities strive to operate this process through a model that is sustainable to nature (i.e. water as a resource) and the financials of their business. However, networks are facing growing challenges (growing water scarcity, pressure on operational costs, water leakages, and waste) that could be mitigated with accurate metering solutions. The AquaMaster4 is the ideal flowmeter for potable water distribution networks and the high-tech response to the global need for water crisis mitigation and adaptation. It is the world's first self-verifying flowmeter which allows the integrity of the meter to be self-checked every 30 minutes and ensures meters are accurate and reliable. Using readily available standard lithium cells, the AquaMaster4 can be operated for over 10 years, and the transmitter can be powered by a range of green energy sources.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility
Tags: Drinking-water, Sensors & monitoring

Solution on-sentence summary: Energy and nutrients reclaimed from domestic wastewater treatment plants
Identification:
Hydrell technology was invented in 2016.



It has developed a wastewater treatment technology that allows the recovery of energy, nutrients, and clean water at a much smaller footprint and price than competing technologies. The technology will also be more robust than current comparable systems. Using the Hydrell technology, users have an incentive to treat their wastewater by saving 30%+ of their total operating costs. In its simplest form, the electrolysis of wastewater is catalysed by electroactive microorganisms oxidising organic and inorganic compounds on the anode (the positive electrode). The reaction products are car­bon dioxide (CO2) and nitrogen gas (N2). At the same time, hydrogen gas (H2) is formed on the cathode and converted to methane by methanogenic microbes.
Looking For: Network, Funding, Credibility
Tags: Electrolysis, Biogas & biomethane, Biofuel, Water & Wastewater treatment, Domestic & municipal wastewater, Waste-to-energy & fuels, Recycle waste

The Financial benefits: Five years breakeven;CHF 300,000 customer benefit each year from energy savings and generation;

Solution on-sentence summary: A cloud-based energy exchange platform enabling the energy transition

eNet is digitalizing the energy industry and connecting all energy industry players on one platform and solving the following problems:



For end consumers:

With the platform, consumers have the ability to decide for themselves where their energy comes from. For example, it can come from their neighbours or the utility company in their area owning a power plant. For energy providers:

The platform covers the current and future legislative requirements in the energy industry and generates new digital business models.



For installers and engineering companies:

It can offer and sell its physical or virtual products to a wide audience.



Other players:

Other players can use the platform to connect users, data, and devices, such as charging stations, with each other.

Solution on-sentence summary: A small machine using salt, vinegar and water to produce a zero-waste, toxic-free disinfectant
Identification:
With Blue, customers can replace toxic, plastic waste-producing cleaning products using a small machine that turns salt, vinegar, and tap water into a zero-waste, toxic-free and efficient disinfectant and cleaner. The mainstream cleaning products are made of 10% active agents, often toxic, transported with water in disposable plastic that threaten your health and the environment with plastic waste and toxic rejections in wastewater. Blue uses less than 2g of salt and vinegar and tap water to produce 350ml of a powerful yet harmless and efficient cleaning product that will replace 90% of what you keep in your cupboard in 10 minutes.

The final product is a certified disinfectant, proved cleaner, and deodorizer that is family-safe (no allergens, no endocrine disruptors, no hazard pictograms), zero-waste, and can be thrown away without harming the planet.

Solution on-sentence summary: A smart waste compactor reducing garbage volume at the source
Identification: Overflowing dustbins are a common sight in public places. The root cause of this problem is loose waste that occupies much more space than its actual volume. Garbage, in an uncompacted state, tend to overflow dustbins- and create an unhygienic atmosphere. They require frequent clearing, which ultimately increases the workload of health and sanitation workers. Garbage typically are then transported to open landfills further causing air, water and land pollution, adding to the health and environmental concerns. In most countries, only a fraction of the total garbage is sent for waste processing. The logistics cost is spent in garbage collection from door to door, waste processing centres, and landfill sites. Such collection trips are expensive due to the high number of trips required, fuel and labour cost involved, etc. The solution, RecycloBin is a smart waste compactor bin that aims at bringing efficiency in the current waste management systems by reducing waste volume at the source. RecycloBin can reduce space occupied by loose waste by at least 6 to 10 times as compared to regular dustbins. This solution aims to bring profitability and sustainability into the current waste management systems.

Solution on-sentence summary: A sustainable tile product favoring the employment of vulnerable individuals
Identification: Sustainable engineering for construction products is the order of the day in all areas of our society. This design methodology will become one of the most important product design methodologies in the coming years due to our needs. This sustainable engineering seeks the balance between our social needs (high quality, aesthetics, safety and comfort), providing solutions to our society, reducing costs associated with its manufacture and that means it is accessible to all and finally, something as important as being respectful with the environment. Eco Mallas by ECOCERAMIC are the perfect example of a product made with sustainable engineering. Eco Mallas are mosaics made under a highly sustainable industrial process, in which in addition to containing recycled pre-consumer material, the final product contains material that comes from other final products already manufactured and that reach the end of their life cycle. In addition, Eco Mallas are made by people with disabilities and manually, so our Eco Mallas product contributes to the improvement and helps the employment of one of the most vulnerable sectors of society.

Solution on-sentence summary: A bio-based solvent for extraction of vegetable oils and lipophilic fractions in the agri-food sector
Identification: For the production of oils, especially edible oils, 2 technics are used which are cold pressing for high quality virgin oils, and/or solvent extraction for commodity large volume oils, such as sunflower or rapeseed oils. For the solvent extraction step the current state of the art technology is the use of Hexane, a petrochemical solvent. Hexane is dangerous and toxic for people exposed, such as workers, but as well consumers, because traces are still found in final products brought into the food supply chain. The Solution, EcoXtract, is a safe, non toxic extraction biobased solvent derived from agriculture by-products. This solvent is eco-friendly for users, consumers and as well for the environment as it is biodegradable and reduce carbon footprint of processes where it is implemented. EcoXtract allows the production of  clean human food and animal feed products but could also benefit other industries such as cosmetics, food supplements, pharmaceuticals, flavours and fragrances.

Solution on-sentence summary: Affordable, safe drinking water refill dispensers
Identification: The Waterpod by I-Drop focuses on providing solutions to two global issues - access to affordable, safe drinking water and preventing single-use plastic waste from pre-bottled water. I-Drop designs, builds and installs self-service purified drinking water refill dispensers called Waterpods for installation in grocery stores, hospitality and public spaces. The solution targets areas with limited access to clean drinking water where consumers need or want an affordable alternative to bottled water. The solution is an innovative product and business model, enabled through a custom-built IOT monitoring and control platform, designed to be as efficient and affordable as possible, expanding the market to consumers who could not previously afford a safe drinking water alternative and enabling those who already purchase bottled water to easily switch.

Solution on-sentence summary: A packaging service minimizing the environmental impact of e-commerce
Identification: With almost 15 billion single-use packaging sent in the world in 2018 and 10% annual growth, e-commerce shipments are generating 4 million tonnes of waste per year. And after Asia closed its doors to the waste from Europe, including cardboard, European recycling centers are saturated. Paper mills factories are now prioritising corporate waste, which is less mixed and less contaminated with other waste than household waste. Other types of cardboard waste are often incinerated or buried. Hipli is acting to minimize the environmental impact of the e-commerce packaging by helping brands to offer a great customer experience without generating waste while reducing significantly the environmental footprint of e-commerce shipments. A packaging as a service for e-commerce: mailers that can be reused 100 times and a logistics to ensure that they are really returned and reused.

Solution on-sentence summary: A hybrid technology solution for the treatment of industrial wastewater containing micropollutants
Identification:
The Solution provides a sustainable, profitable and reliable on-site unit for the treatment and purification of pharmaceutical and chemical wastewaters. It provides an alternative for transport and incineration of hazardous wastewater and removes micropollutants such as Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients and endocrine disruptors. The Solution provides a technical and economical feasible answer to the emerging problem of water quality and drinking water availability.

The solution combines 3 different complementary technology modules and removes and converts active pharmaceutical ingredients via oxygen and ozone, ozonolysis, into biodegradable compounds that can be further treated in biological wastewater treatment. The solution makes it possible to avoid the discharge of pharmaceuticals into surface water and the environment in general.

Solution on-sentence summary: Reshaping the world of packaging through its revolutionary dry forming manufacturing technology and next-generation fibre-based solutions
Identification: Yangi supports brands and converters in achieving their sustainability targets by helping them transform their packaging portfolio into new alternative renewable and sustainable packaging solutions. They assist their partners from ideation through implementation by developing and selling production solutions for dry forming including a turn-key manufacturing machine platform as well as added value services such as customised material recipes, materials on subscription, and ready-made design concepts. Converters and brands can move into more sustainable packaging solutions that offer competitive production costs, fully renewable raw materials and resource-efficient production. Practically speaking, their dry forming technology is a combination of air-laid formation and fast pressing that utilizes cellulose fibres to create 3D-formed packaging without using process water. Cellulose materials fulfil the key requirements of recyclability, rigidity and 3D formation. Yangi can produce 3D-formed packaging directly from cellulose pulp in one machine line at a 30% lower cost than existing fibre-based solutions, with minimal water and less energy use, resulting in a 75% reduction in CO2 emissions. Also, compared to other cellulose materials, dry formed packaging is unique in terms of shapeability, aesthetics, and appearance. Depending on packaging requirements, barrier chemistry can be added in the process or added in a separate sequence afterward.

Solution on-sentence summary: A solid state electrochemical device capturing and recycling waste hydrogen gas
Identification: Hydrogen is used as a process atmosphere in many industries, most notably metal treating, powder metallurgy, glassmaking, and semiconductor manufacturing. It is typically vented during these processes in the same stream as other waste gas components. To date, the waste hydrogen gas has typically not been recovered for reuse. H2RENEW™ Electrochemical Hydrogen Separation and Compression are clean technologies developed by SKYRE to tackle this challenge. SKYRE's builds and sells two products. One captures and recycles hydrogen from waste industrial streams. The other captures and converts carbon dioxide into useful fuels and chemicals. Both deliver up to a 50% cost advantage and a 50% reduction in emission of greenhouse gases over competitive methods and products.

Solution on-sentence summary: Affordable and inclusive gas solution providing clean cooking for the low-income communities
Identification: The existing energetic offer lacks a clean, accessible and affordable option to cook, adapted to the low-income population’s needs: in Africa, electricity is often not accessible and the common use of biomass (paraffin, coal, wood) burnt in open fires is extremely harmful for the consumers' health and the environment. Gas (LPG) could be the solution improving public health, reducing air pollution, with a very low environmental footprint; but the distribution and purchase barriers are too high to let traditional LPG companies to invest on serving the low-income segment. Pay-as-you-Gas is an accessible, affordable, inclusive and eco-responsible clean cooking solution: through the implementation of dispensing gas stations in townships in South Africa -managed by local micro-entrepreneurs-, Pay-as-you-Gas is giving access to LPG gas to low-income communities, fractioning quantities via a Pay-As-You-Go patented system, and avoiding the use of expensive and polluting solutions such as coal or paraffin.

Solution on-sentence summary: A low impact leather-like material from mushroom mycelium
Identification: The solution aims at having low negative impacts on environmental and human health, in comparison with mainstream leathers (animal leather). This solution is made by turning agroforestry waste, such as sawdust, into a growth medium for mushroom mycelia. The humidity and temperature of the mycelia are closely regulated during the incubation period, which is carried out for several weeks until the mycelia layer grows the appropriate thickness. Then, the mycelia are processed by using chromium-free natural dyes. The process doesn't involve animal killings and the mushrooms can grow in vertical farming while consuming less water and emiting low carbon emission. Mylea is a real and convenient alternative to the mainstream leather. The mycelium leather material can be processed further by craftsmen into various products such as wallets, bags, shoes and many more.

Target client profile: BusinessManufacturingFurniture & Home Accessories, BusinessManufacturingLeather, BusinessManufacturingTextiles & Clothes

Solution on-sentence summary: An electric mobility energy network for light vehicles in Africa which is cheaper and more powerful
Identification: Ampersand offers electric motorcycles and a battery swap station network to power the motorcycle taxi drivers of East Africa. A driver can purchase or lease a motorcycle from Ampersand at a competitive cost with petrol incumbents. Batteries are owned by Ampersand and provided to drivers as a service. Drivers pay for the electricity the same way as petrol – they only pay for what they use. When a new battery is needed, a driver can quickly swap it out for a new one at one of Ampersand’s many conveniently located swap stations, without having to wait for it to charge. 35 motorbikes and batteries have now covered well over 1.3 million km on the streets of Kigali since May 2019.  Ampersand has 7200 drivers signed up to our waiting list.

Solution on-sentence summary: A smart home technology automating energy savings by analyzing energy needs of buildings
Identification: Nowadays a certain number of challenges in the energy sector and residential construction can be observed including high energy bills due to energy overconsumption in buildings or high operating costs for housing associations due to the lack of vision over the current state and energy consumption of their building stock. Solution on-sentence summary: Solar panel solution for the mobile tank vaporiser
Identification: In remote operations electric supply may not be possible from a standard land line. Without electric supply, the digital control panel, its level, pressure and telemetry would not work, and without these data, liquified nitrogen or oxygen delivery to refill the mobile tank vaporiser can not be properly planned. The Air Gas Mobile Tank Vaporiser Unit conditioned with Solar Panel aims to deliver large amounts of nitrogen or oxygen both in gas or liquid phase, in remote sites without previous arrangements, with a controlled and efficient supply of product and optimised carbon footprint. The main issues this Solution addresses are the excessive trips a conventional tank vaporiser usually performs in order to maintain non-stop operations, given the lack of proper logistics, which could cause unnecessary CO2 emissions.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

Solution on-sentence summary: An energy self-serviced boat built to actively collect plastic garbage out of the water to recycle waste
Identification: The Circular Explorer aims to tackle one of the world's biggest environmental challenges: plastic. By collecting, sorting, re- and upcycling plastic waste from rivers and coastal areas, the Circular Explorer contributes to healthier marine ecosystems and engages with local partners for the most impactful and sustainable recycling solutions. Powered by solar energy, no emissions are generated during the process. However, that's not where the work of the Circular Explorer stops. Through a dedicated educational and scientific program, awareness of the circular economy is built, insights for better waste management are gained and communities around the world are engaged to reduce waste in the first place.

Solution on-sentence summary: A bio-architecture for energy efficient, natural buildings
Identification:
In the EU, buildings under construction are responsible for 40% of energy consumption, 36% of CO2 emissions and generate 1/3 of all waste. Moreover, most of the construction materials used are of petrochemical origin and have a linear life cycle. According to the “Sick building syndrome”, 40% of all materials used in the construction sector are hazardous. From an agricultural point of view, rice is the most consumed food globally with 66% of the world population basing their diet on rice. Every hectare of rice field produces 7 tons of edible product and 10 tons of residues, which must be dismantled. These by-products are burned on a global level, emitting a significant quantity of CO2. Rice Husk's solution tackles the challenging occurring in both the construction and agricultural sector. 

The company transforms rice residues into 100% natural construction materials that at the end of their service life return to nature. In particular, the company supplies 100% natural insulation material based on rice husk. By using an approach based on bio-architecture, the company enables the construction of energy-efficient, natural buildings, using low-cost rice residues.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Construction, Waste-to-materials, Agricultural Waste, Bran & husk waste, Thermal insulation, Recycle waste, Construction materials
The environmental benefits: 100% natural insulation materials based on rice husk ;By using only the Italian rice residue, 75% of the entire Italian construction assets could be rebuilt;Thermal conductivity of 0.036 W/mk;410 tons of CO2 saved through Ricehouse projects;100% biodegradable product;20% reduction of CO2 compared to traditional building materials ;
The Financial benefits: Reduction on energy costs for more than 30%;Creation of new job opportunities in the agricultural sector connected with the collection and management of the rice residues ;

Solution on-sentence summary: A non-thermal plasma nitrogen fixation system for direct application to growers
Identification: Redhill Scientific enables growers to make as much fertilizer as needed, transforming an unavoidable, wildly variable, recurring expense into a one-time capitalized expense. The patented technology uses zero fossil fuels, has zero carbon releases, and can be powered by on-site renewable electricity sources such as wind and solar energy. Redhill's green technology replicates a naturally occurring process in lightning by combining air, water, and electricity to create enough fertilizer for any sized farm. Redhill's agricultural product line can create unlimited amounts of all-natural aqueous nitrogen fertilizer on-site and on-demand, potentially eliminating a grower’s unavoidable recurring cost while reducing fears of runoff and pollution. Additionally, this Solutions can treat contaminated liquids more thoroughly and faster than other existing methods- potentially saving years on project lifetimes and lowering the time-cost of money for remediation engineering firms.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

Solution on-sentence summary: A special cement used to improve and stabilize soils for sustainable road construction
Identification: Holcim Base Vial modifies the characteristics of the soils and the granular bases (new or existing) by incorporating cement and water, improving its mechanical properties as the cement hydrates. Using Holcim Base Vial implies an increase in the rigidity and mechanical resistance of the granular material. Consequently, it allows them to be more resistant to the permanent deformation that trucks induce to the pavement structure. These mechanical advantages translate into a considerable structural contribution that allows the thickness of the pavement structure to be reduced without affecting its structural capacity. From an environmental point of view, the implementation of Holcim Base Vial represents a great advantage because it decreases the need to search and exploit sources of very high-quality aggregates due to the improvement of the mechanical properties of the site soils.

Solution on-sentence summary: A mobile sensor network for local air quality monitoring and data visualization
Identification: AtmoTrack is the first environmental life quality monitoring network, street by street in real time. The innovators' mission is to democratize the means of understanding air quality, while contributing to the reduction of human impact on our environment. Based on a large network of embedded sensors on professional fleets, street furniture or buildings, the platform provides access to actionable and precise information on environment quality. Solution on-sentence summary: A sustainable smart village for the rural world
Identification:
The SUEZ Smart Village is a game-changer for emerging countries that will face strong uncontrolled urbanisation and increased climate change effects. It consists of an integrated solution aiming at providing basic services to isolated populations or in rural areas.

It is composed of a compact drinking water production unit, an off-grid energy supply unit and latrines coupled with a biogas plant treating the organic waste and producing cooking gas. Moreover, considering the utilities provided, the shipping containers can be reused and arranged for other services such as wifi, money transfer, post office. This solution creates real "city centers" in remote areas of developing countries in order to encourage the settlement of populations while offering concrete solutions to the challenges of climate change. Suez Smart Village is also a social project, avoiding massive migrations towards big cities.

Solution on-sentence summary: Real-time indoor air quality monitoring and automation for buildings
Identification: Hardware and data analytics to help businesses today address indoor environmental concerns in an energy-efficient way. Kaiterra’s commercial air quality monitoring solution and data analytics provide a way for people to see the air they are breathing and improve their indoor environment via data-driven, energy-efficient strategies. Solution on-sentence summary: A cordless rain water tank helping you to water your garden in a more sustainable way
Identification: GardenPump 18 aims at providing clients with a sustainable and profitable option to water their gardens. Good for the environment and better for plants – the cordless GardenPump 18 works easily with all styles of garden rainwater tanks and provides faster and more effective watering around the garden. This Rainwater Pump is perfect for natural and more enjoyable watering of flower beds and fruit and vegetables, or pots and planters. Within the banded area the average household with a water tank should be able collect in excess of 1000 litres of rainwater per annum for garden use. We estimate that there are possibly 6 million water tanks in use in Europe so there is potential to save 6 billion litres of tap grade water. Garden Pump 18 has a similar flow rate to an outside tap so the water saving is actually the key factor. For users who currently use watering cans, this Solution will save considerable time and effort undertaking the watering process.
Looking For: Visibility, New clients, Credibility
Tags: Gardening, Water pumping, Irrigation

The Financial benefits: 10 times cheaper than using a water can with tap ;Payback time in 2 weeks;2 880€ saved every year per GardenPump 18V user (at least 14 400€ saved during the GP lifetime);

Solution on-sentence summary: High definition, homogeneous and precise weather data for the emerging world
Identification:
Meteorological and climate events directly affect 70% of companies’ activities in the world, and 80% of the world’s land is not covered by radar. This poses financial, social, and environmental issues, which is why HD Rain offers an expert solution with high-definition weather observations and forecasts. The data generated enables companies, governments, and individuals to be more informed, resilient, and efficient when dealing with meteorological and climate change. The company’s innovation lies in the use of TV satellite to generate data via the use of robust, autonomous, and efficient sensors and artificial intelligence algorithms. 

HD Rain offers precipitation maps among other products and services, with a spatial resolution of 500 meters by 500 meters, a forecast of up to 2 hours and minute-by-minute data processing.

This innovative solution is customizable and responds to both developed and developing countries needs for high-definition, ultra-local and low-cost weather data.

Tags: Reusable, Algorithms & AI, Sensors & monitoring, Wind power, Stormwater runoffs

Solution on-sentence summary: Smart ev routing making charging and driving evs effortless and efficient
Identification: The electric mobility ecosystem is extremely fragmented. It is complicated for individual drivers and fleet operators to drive EVs effortlessly over long distances, across borders, or use them with high commercial intensity. This is because on-route charging is complex due to the different standards in plug-type, charge power, payment systems, waiting-lines, variable charge speeds, and outside variables like temperature, weather, topography, that impact the range of a battery. Traditional routing engines cannot deal with all these additional variables. This solution seeks to overcome this challenge by providing an EV routing engine that makes EVs predictable. The routing algorithm considers 15 static and dynamic variables to calculate the best route to a driver's destination and identifies the optimal charge stations in between. Our routing engine is exposed through a GraphQL API that is easy to integrate into existing consumer navigation and telemetric fleet applications.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Target client profile: Individual, BusinessServicesInfrastructureRoads & Road Traffic Infrastructure, BusinessServicesTransportersTrucks & Other Road Vehicles
Tags: Electric, Cars, EV charging, Route optimization, Software, Vehicles, Electric vehicles
Sectors: Mobility, Sell and trade, Energy and fuel efficiency
The environmental benefits: EV database contains consumption models of 246 EVs.;Routing engine comes pre-integrated with a pan-European charge station database that counts 110,000 locations (as of April 2021);The Chargetrip technology has been validated by hundreds of drivers in Europe and New Zealand;
The Financial benefits: Payback period of around 4 months for API clients;TCOs of an EV are 5% lower than for a similar ICE vehicle;

Solution on-sentence summary: An automated system to save up to 20% of fuel for transportation vessels
Identification: Beyond the Sea is developing a kite propulsion system to reduce fuel consumption and gas emissions in maritime transport. Today, shipping accounts for 90% of world trade and emitted 1,046 million tonnes of CO2 in 2007. Today, most ship owners are facing a decline in revenue in a competitive market due to the changing price of oil. By using wind as a source of energy, equipped ships will reduce their greenhouse gas emissions as part of the energy used will be renewable. The kite, in addition to helping to propel the boat, will reduce fuel consumption. Studies show that 20% of the fuel will be saved at constant speed. Depending on the desired speed, the engine can be turned off completely, and the boat will then use only the wind - a free and environmentally friendly source of energy - for propulsion.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Credibility
Tags: Boats, Cargo ships, Route optimization, Maritime shipping, Wind power, Vehicles
Sectors: Freight, Mobility, Energy and fuel efficiency

Solution on-sentence summary: A new wave-powered, flexible seawater desalination system for developing countries
Identification: According to UNDP, today more than 1 billion people lack access to clean and safe drinking water and the situation will dramatically worsen in the next 20 years unless clean water supplies increase by about 50% and access is more evenly distributed. To tackle this challenge, Resolute Marine developed Wave2O™. Wave2O™ technology is a proprietary seawater desalination process that couples Resolute Marine’s wave energy converters with onshore desalination and electricity generating plants. While this solution has been designed with simple operation and maintenance in mind, it incorporates several innovative and patented technologies. Resolute Marine’s mission is to significantly improve access to water for coastal populations and industrial/agricultural operations in developing countries and small island developing states (SIDS) and to displace the diesel-electric desalination system that are in common use worldwide. The key technologies that enable Wave2O™ have been validated in a series of tests which have proven to be reliable and cost-effective to produce clean water in multiple places and across multiple uses around the world.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners
Tags: Coastal, Marine & Oceans, Desalination (= seawater purification), Wave & Tidal power
The environmental benefits: Employs several wave energy converters (WECs) that pressurize seawater which is piped ashore to directly drive a seawater reverse-osmosis (RO) desalination system;Wave2O™ requires no other sources of energy other than ocean waves;Due to the low permeate recovery ratio and the relatively small size of Wave2O™ plants, the post-production brine is diluted to a point where it presents no harm to the environment;Wave2O™ is powered by an abundant, inexhaustible, consistent and clean renewable energy resource and has been designed so that post-process brine can be discharged directly into the sea without harm;Each 4,000 m3/day Wave2O™ plant that replaces an equivalent-size diesel-powered plant will cut CO2 emission by 5,500 tons per year which corresponds to taking 1,050 cars off the road;
The Financial benefits: The operation and maintenance of Wave2O™ systems and the production of wave energy converters will require skilled local labor and suppliers and will create many local jobs;A 4,000 m3/day Wave2OTM plant can produce water at €1.20/m3 which is less than the €3.60/m3 minimum of diesel-electric desalination systems and 3.7x lower than the average cost of water in Cabo Verde;

Solution on-sentence summary: A tri-generation energy management solution for simultaneous storage, use and distribution of electricity
Identification: MAN ETES stands for Electro-Thermal Energy Storage; it produces and stores heat, cold and electricity at a large scale. Therefore, it is the ideal system for the increasingly important "Sector Coupling", meaning the merging of energy suppliers and consumers. MAN ETES helps municipalities, institutions and companies to reach their goal of CO2 neutrality by providing a system that is completely environmentally friendly and decarbonizing. In contrast to the majority of the competition, this solution uses CO2 as a refrigerant, which is neither toxic to its environment nor flammable as well as inexpensive and easily accessible. Furthermore, the technology solution is powered by MAN's HOFIM® compressor with an integrated expander, which is hermetically-sealed and operating without lube oil. MAN ETES, with electrical inputs from 2 to 14 MW, can provide hundreds of MWh of thermal energy per day and unit with temperature levels between 0° and 150°C.

Solution on-sentence summary: A portable, fast, accurate, and simple water testing system
Identification: Water Lens is a portable, fast, accurate, and simple water testing system that improves public health and reduces reliance on scarce freshwater resources. The test is easy enough that anyone can test water anywhere in the world by themselves. No lab and no chemist required. The Water Lens system is run with 3 simple steps. Results are generated by colourimetric assays run in parallel. Water Lens software automatically processes the raw data and generates a formal water quality report. In addition to water composition, this report contains technical insights on the chemical properties and characteristics of the water sample. The entire process can be completed in less than 15 minutes. Most industries deal with water-related issues every day. However, waiting for days and weeks to get results back from the laboratories causes major repair, maintenance, and environmental issues. By obtaining results in real-time, companies can proactively address water issues.

Solution on-sentence summary: A cost-efficient, lightweight and fuel-efficient irrigation system
Identification: It is of utmost importance to push agricultural development in a sustainable, clean and economical direction. Seeking to achieve these goals, PROTECTOR emerges as an absolutely novel, and easy to use accessory based on a non-stick and water repellent protective film system placed between the ground and the polyethylene hose, protecting hose from gluing, strenuous abrasions and high friction. It is a fully automated self-efficient device with an autonomous mechanism. PROTECTOR allows the use of thinner hoses (cheaper than traditional long hoses) and lighter tractors (which are cheaper and more manageable), plus makes possible to use longer hoses in a more efficient way. In consequence, it reduces the high energy consumption used for pumping water and for positioning the hose, allowing sprinklers to work at more adequate pressure. PROTECTOR makes agriculture more environmentally sustainable: water is used more efficiently, energy consumption and associated GHG emissions are reduced and less plastic is used.

Solution on-sentence summary: Artificial intelligence for saving water resources and energy on water distribution networks
Identification: HpO® aims at making public water distribution networks more efficient, sustainable and resilient today and in the next decades. HpO® relies on Artificial Intelligence and engineering services to predict failures, prevent leaks and save water resources and energy on water distribution networks. It gives two valuable outputs: which streets to inspect first for leak detection so as to reduce the duration of existing leaks; and which network components to replace first for maximum technical and financial performance to reduce the number of leaks in the future. HpO® also accounts for the ageing of water networks everywhere in the world. They are buried and the threat remains invisible. The investment costs for water network replacement are too high to be sustainable on a short period of time. This investment has to be stretched out over decades, starting today. HpO® helps to predict risks and target the replacements where they will be the most efficient, year after year.

Solution on-sentence summary: A low carbon footprint solution for the cement and concrete industry
Identification: Cement production is responsible for 9% of global CO2 emissions. Today fly-ash (a byproduct from coal-fired power plants) is being added to keep both carbon footprint and costs down. However, as coal-fired power generation is being phased out in many regions of the world, there is a shortage resulting in increased pricing. The cement and concrete industry are forced to find alternatives and the CemShaleTM product produced with the CemTowerTM equipment is meeting their growing needs. The CemShaleTM + CemTowerTM solution provides a high-performance low-cost and low-carbon footprint cement additive, utilizing abundantly available raw materials. CemShaleTM produced on CemTowerTM is cheaper to produce, based on shale which is excavated in the same locations as other cement raw material (limestone) and is globally available in abundance. Additionally,  CemShaleTM has a 95% lower carbon footprint than cement and can substitute up to 35% of the final cement within already ratified standards without compromising the properties of the end product. The technology has a global reach and brings the opportunity to reduce global CO2 emissions by up to 4.81% by 2050.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Biobased, Cement, Industrial additives, Construction materials
Sectors: Waste/Pollution, Industry/Goods, Manufacturing and construction processes, Solid waste management

Solution on-sentence summary: A process that reduces energy consumption for the industrial thermal drying process
Identification: The Coomtech SMR solution to drying bulk solids materials of surface moisture works by shearing the moisture off particles in controlled turbulent airflow. Warmed to an average of 85C,  it optimises its ability to hold the water separate from the particles. It is a lean phase process treating particles in under a second, dealing with a range of moisture levels dependant upon the material dried. It presents a singular and viable alternative to thermal drying which is the traditional approach, heating water till it reaches 100C then on up to vaporisation. Because it is only heating air to 85C and air does all the work of stripping, the Coomtech SMR system delivers a lower cost and lower emissions system over the life of a plant. It’s a modular configuration that can manage from 32,000 mtpa up to multiple hundreds of thousands of tonnes. The plant can integrate with existing systems including using low-grade waste heat sources or can be a standalone remote plant.
Looking For: New clients, Funding, Partners
Tags: Manufacturing, Industrial process heat
Sectors: Industry/Goods, Industrial Heat, Manufacturing and construction processes
The environmental benefits: Energy costs can be cut by up to 75% from thermal drying by traditional technologies;Can cut up to 75% of the CO2 emissions versus a thermal drying plant;The system is gentle and low temperature for materials sensitive to those characteristics and tends to break up softer agglomerates sending the particle size distribution toward the finer end for most products with agglomerating tendencies.;Can save up to 75% CO2 emissions per tonne of dried material compared to various designs and levels of efficient thermal drier currently available;Water recovered in the process can be recycled or reused for example 17% removed from a tonne creates  c.170kg of water ;
The Financial benefits: The consequence of reduced energy demand is CO2 emissions are reduced and in todays market carbon saved has a value and is rising in value in the European and in the global trading markets;Savings on OPEX and potential carbon trades mean that payback periods can be as low as 18 to 36 months for Coomtech over thermal technologies.;

Solution on-sentence summary: An innovative hydraulic reservoir that replaces bulky & heavy traditional reservoirs
Identification: Common hydraulic oil reservoirs (CHR) found on industrial machines are often large and heavy. CHR volumes are typically between 100-500 litres of oil. The innovative Variable Volume Reservoir (VVR) solution has a capacity of just 7-21 litres, whilst providing the same or better results. The VVR weights up to 100 times less and reduces oil use by up to 50 times when compared to mainstream reservoirs. Furthermore, its much-reduced weight brings benefits for fuel economy when installed on mobile machines. Should a leak occur, the VVR will have minimal impact on the environment, resulting in lower decontamination costs and prohibitive fines. Being airless and sealed, the VVR works in any environment (from under-sea to high altitude) and in any orientation. Its versatility makes a perfect fit for numerous applications exposed to difficult conditions where CHRs is no match. Lastly, its small volume makes it more appealing to fill with bio-fluids, which can be very expensive when used in CHRs.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Credibility, Partners
Tags: Lightweight, Fuel efficiency, Hydropower
The environmental benefits: Up to 50 times smaller than traditional reservoirs with the same performance, leading to large reduction in oil use;Sealed and airless, preventing contamination and moisture entering the fluid, consequently prolonging fluid life by 3 to 5 times;Up to 100 times lighter than traditional reservoirs, resulting in fuel savings on mobile machines and less pollution;
The Financial benefits: Reduced fluid use with the same performance delivers significant cost savings;Payback in less than three years;

Solution on-sentence summary: Secure land rights documents for smallholder farmers
Identification: The land titling solution aims at delivering affordable land titles at scale to smallholder farmers by working in partnerships with the world's largest food companies, traders and governments. Meridia's solution provides smallholder farmers with formal land rights documents that put them on the path to a better income, autonomy and the freedom to take care of their farmland. On top of that, land mapping and titling provide the companies with solid insights into the value chain and traceability to farm level, preventing reputation risks from practices like deforestation and improving the return on investment in farmer productivity programs. By working together, land documentation is provided to the people who need it the most, families living off the land in places like Ghana and Indonesia. These families are smallholder farmers, the very ones producing the worlds food, such as rice, coffee, cocoa, palm oil and tea. Not only do these farmers produce our food, but they are also first in line to protect the world's forests, as they often live in or around the rainforests that are critical for maintaining biodiversity and combatting climate change. With a land document, these farmers can invest in the future of their land and their children.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners
Tags: Developing countries, Soil and land
Sectors: Food/Agri, Project planning, Sell and trade

Solution on-sentence summary: Increasing the recycling rates of used aluminum coffee capsules
Identification: Used coffee capsules are mostly disposed as waste that ends up in the landfill. Coffee brands are increasingly searching for ways to increase the recycling rate of these capsules. The current way of recycling by the consumer is unpractical, unhygienic and not efficient. The Coffeecoiner is a kitchen tool that fits in your cutlery drawer or next to your coffee machine. The tool serves the purpose to remove used  coffee grounds from the used capsule. What remains is a flat disc of aluminum, called the Coffeecoin. The coffee grounds can be used for several household, garden and cosmetic purposes. The Coffeecoins can be melted into any new aluminum product, as aluminum does not degenerate when recycled. In this way waste is turned into a resource. The Coffeecoiner itself is made from recycled aluminum. Separating the coffee grounds from the capsule leads to a significant reduction in CO2 emissions because of large logistic savings.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

Identification: Today, 2.1 billion people still do not have access to safe drinking water. The situation will worsen by 2030 with more than 8.5 billion people on earth. Solution on-sentence summary: Reduced ammonia and co2 emissions from dairy farms while increasing profitability
Identification: DELTA X is a technological solution for dairy farms that reduces ammonia emissions by 70% and CO2 emissions by 25% and increases profitability by 345€/year/cow. This results from the division by 2 of hoof, Mortellaro and mastitis diseases, and the increase from 2.8 to 3.2 in the number of lactations. Diseases of paws, Mortellaro, mastitis and ammonia and CO2 emissions are currently mainly caused by the liquid / solid mixture (slurry) and its prolonged exposure to air and contacts with animals. The DELTA X system is easily installed by the breeder both in existing and new barns. The return on investment is 3.3 years, excluding any aid depending on the country.

Solution on-sentence summary: A csr tool for the online tree planting service sector
Identification: Deforestation is clearing Earth's forests on a massive scale, resulting in damage to the quality of the land. Consequences are the loss of habitat, desertification, soil deterioration; more massive amounts of greenhouse gases entering the atmosphere and not reabsorbed; displacement of local communities and their traditional way of life and income sources. In the last decades, we have witnessed how environmental deterioration has had effects on the natural world and social well-being. Treedom decided to take concrete action by focusing on the deforestation and mismanagement of forest systems in rural communities. Treedom tackle as well the lack of funding opportunities preventing small farmers to engage in agroforestry activities, the loss of biodiversity and the information bias that discourages donors from financing initiatives managed by rural communities. Treedom is an innovative web platform that allows its users to plant a tree at a distance and track it online providing economic and social benefit for rural communities while creating an engaging and viable CSR tool. Since its founding in 2010, Treedom has introduced innovation and transparency within an industry still tied to the old charity concept, succeeding in transforming good action into a modern communication and engagement tool. Treedom is an innovative, transparent and versatile engaging solution.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Trees & Forests, Gaseous waste capture, Investment, Carbon offset, Traceability, Corporate & Employees

Solution on-sentence summary: A lightweight, yet powerful generator using compressed hydrogen for the marine environment
Identification: The UP400 aims at providing hydrogen-based zero-emission, silent and safe solutions to the mass market that replaces the conventional diesel solutions. The UP system is designed to be plug and play making it appealing to new users that wish to integrate innovative solutions on a sailboat, campervan or as a backup generator in their home. By using lightweight type 4 carbon composite cylinders in combination with the UP400, users can achieve better weight to power ratio than lithium batteries. Furthermore, this solution is designed to work both as a sole power source or in combination with other green solution can create a truly autonomous micro-smart grid. This accessible and simple generator can endure harsh sea conditions much better than conventional solutions. The UP400 is a stackable solution that can go from 400W to 4kW.

Solution on-sentence summary: Chemitek solar wash protect (swp): an eco-friendly cleaning category for solar pv panels
Identification: Chemitek's Solar Wash Protect (SWP) is an eco-friendly and biodegradable cleaning product with washing and protection properties, developed and certified for solar panels. SWP presents innovative and efficient characteristics to clean and protect solar PV panels, significantly improving their power generation performance and reducing their maintenance needs and costs. Cleaning panels with SWP instead of just with water delivers significant water savings, decreasing the volume of water waste by 20% per panel. After washing, the protective anti-adherent characteristic will reduce the adhesion of soiling to the panel keeping it cleaner for a longer period of time. Gains in efficiency of up to 4% can be achieved due to the anti-adherent characteristics left on the panel post-wash. This solution delivers enhanced energy gains and reduced water use, all whilst saving money for the user.

Solution on-sentence summary: A new category of ultraviolet disinfection system
Identification: The Solution provides safe and clean disinfection of potable water "on demand" without the use of chemicals or mercury containing components. The basis of UV disinfection is the application of a germicidal wavelength emission (UV-C) targeting microorganism DNA which is disrupted and therefore can not replicate and hence is not able to induce illness or disease. The application of UV for this purpose is well understood and accepted. The novelty of this solution is the utilization of compact UV-C LED technology in place of existing solutions that use mercury vapor lamps to emit the necessary germicidal wavelengths. Compact dimensions and straightforward installation means the Solution can easily be integrated into typical drinking water dispensing products close to the point of consumption

Solution on-sentence summary: Benchmarking the alkaline battery market using a diy product
Identification: RegenBox is a collaborative research program aimed at any consumer using alkaline batteries for personal or professional use to regenerate them, although they are supposedly "non-rechargeable". By re-inventing from a patent fallen into the public domain, RegenBox was launched in 2017. RegenBox is the first DIY battery regenerator which reduces the tons of batteries wrongly thrown away. It is capable of regenerating LR6 and LR3 batteries using microelectric pulsions and in the future will be able to regenerate any type of “single use” batteries. RegenBox is designed to be environmentally friendly and against programmed obsolescence. To use RegenBox, users simply have to test the batteries, and if they are in the rechargeable range (0.9 - 1.4 Volt), users just have to plug the battery into the RegenBox and plug it to an electrical source.

Solution on-sentence summary: An energy-efficient platform for city services management
Identification: In many cities, city services are managed independently. Each of the utilities or services has a different power line and they are connected to each other in the same electrical distribution board where each line is managed. So in conventional installations each service has an individual power line. The Smartec solution integrates under one platform as many Smart City services as possible, crossing the data to make those services more efficient and help the city to become more sustainable. With this solution, it's possible to create more added value to the services, for instance, public lighting, maximizing the light when is needed, and to minimize the power consumption. Also, connecting existing legacy systems to the platform would allow a better performance for the control with the same hardware, remote monitoring and integration into the mesh network created by the Smartec system.

Solution on-sentence summary: A collaborative platform for the management and relocation of recycled wooden pallets
Identification: Today, nearly 500 million Euro pallets circulate around the world. But with a loss rate of 10 to 15% – the result of operating in silos and a lack of communication between Supply Chain professionals – this represents a real disaster in economic and environmental terms. Opatrace helps to increase the quantity and quality of recycled and available Euro-pallets, so that the logistics actors are not only using them ... but that they reuse more and better! How? The collaborative platform provides real-time visibility of pallet flows, allowing better restitution, fewer purchases and less waste. By aggregating information, the solution helps supply chain professionals to reduce their losses of wooden pallets and to promote the circular economy of packaging ... While also reducing costs associated with the management and transport of load carriers (less CO2 emissions). From the supplier to the consignee, through the carrier, the whole chain benefits from productivity gains, but also a better management of reverse packaging. By recovering 100% of reusable wooden pallets, we do limit the purchase of new ones and preserve the natural resource and indirectly combat deforestation

Solution on-sentence summary: Mobile unit for the conversion of unused agricultural and woody biomass residues into pellets
Identification:
Proxipel's solution allows the valorization of woody residues into pellets. Today, when they are exploited, they are exploited with very little added value and often emit greenhouse gases. Thanks to mobile innovative units that produce pellets in situ, Proxipel allows to valorize them into renewable energy with a high added value. Here are some examples of woody waste that Proxipel can transform, raw as well as wet:

- fresh wood

- wood waste

- vine shoots

- communal pruning

- forestry residues

- straw

- agricultural residues

- agri-food residues

- etc.



Thanks to the action of the Proxipel units, we will be able to produce pellets locally at a competitive price, while developing the circular economy:

- valorization of locally produced waste

- regional labor force

- consumption of pellets nearby



In addition, this will reduce CO2 emissions and increase energy independence, since 30% of the pellets consumed are imported, both in the EU and in Switzerland.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

Solution on-sentence summary: A new, innovative and sustainable drinking water service for rural Africa
Identification: The United Nations' 6th Sustainable Development Goal (SDG6) aims at "universal and equitable access to safe drinking water, hygiene and sanitation by 2030". Today, in Sub-Saharan Africa, 55% of rural inhabitants do not have basic access to drinking water. UDUMA proposes a real solution for achieving the SDG6 in Sub-Saharan Africa. UDUMA provides a sustainable drinking water service for African villages. In a village that has chosen to delegate its drinking water management service to UDUMA, "intelligent" water points, which enable remote monitoring of consumption and breakdowns, replace pumps that have broken down or are very old. Each inhabitant has an electronic card for simplified payment of the quantities of water they need. Thanks to this approach and the implementation of these innovative tools, professional management is possible: providing services that meet the drinking water needs of rural populations in Sub-Saharan Africa is becoming an economically viable activity

Solution on-sentence summary: In-field sensor-based digital system for intelligent insect monitoring
Identification: VOLITO is a sensor technology for the digitalization of insects monitored pre-harvest in high-input crops. In-field sensors will enable farmers to only treat fields when and where it is really needed. New and improved solutions for farmers at the intersection of sensors, data acquisition and machine learning will assist growers in improving their insect control interventions. The ability to assess in-field insect populations under various conditions reduces the risk of crop failure, drives on-farm profitability, and helps the farmer and the industry to understand the agricultural field-environment interaction. GPS tagged data from all sensor installations will additionally provide the possibility to compare development from field-to-field, region-to-region, and country-to-country over time. This unique database will provide the agrochemical industry, regulators, environmental protection agencies and researchers a possibility to track broader impacts on the environment.

Solution on-sentence summary: Turning mixed non-recyclable solid wastes into hydrogen, power, heat or cooling for direct local use
Identification: Waste is produced everywhere and even the most ambitious circular economy scenarios, predict several hundred of million tons of non-recyclable waste produced all over the world. Dumping and landfilling that waste is no longer an acceptable option. And large scale incineration is struggling with increasing cost, toxic ash residues, stricter emission regulations and social resistance. In addition to recycling leftovers, wastes like medical waste and other hazardous wastes need destruction with minimal environmental impact and maximum capital and energy efficiency – also for developing markets to afford proper treatment preventing waste from leaking into cities, rivers and our oceans. Plasma Assisted Gasification (PAG) is a clean energy recovery technology that transforms non-recyclable waste into hydrogen power, heat or greenhouse-gas-free thermal cooling for direct local use – without toxic residues or urban stress

Solution on-sentence summary: A new generation of biodegradable, efficient, metal-free, non-ion-relating coating and filler for medical devices
Identification: The G3® patented antimicrobial inorganic bioglass is metal and phosphorus-free and consists of a SiO2-Al2O3-Na2O-B2O3-CaO composition that has demonstrated to be very effective against Gram+, Gram-, fungi and corresponding biofilms in both relevant environments and clinical tests. It is easily and economically produced, contains no nanoparticles, and doesn't generate antimicrobial resistance due to its action principle, based on membrane depolarization instead of metal ion membrane adhesion or penetration. It does not leach metal ions or particles, and degrades as any other glass, with a useful life measured in years vs. short lived metal based solutions. It can be integrated in bulk or as additive in fibres, paints, polymers, plastics, cements and ceramics, used directly as coating on various surfaces. It is 100% biocompatible and as a coating can be used on medical devices, or as an additive in bone-grafting solutions. Upon degradation, it is even good for soils due to mineral content.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners
Tags: Biodegradable, Industrial coating, Bacteria, Medical & hygienic, Microorganisms
Sectors: Industry/Goods, Materials and chemicals, Manufacturing and construction processes

Waste has no environmental impact nor ends up as heavy metal in soils, tissues, etc;No need for scarce, expensive and non-renewable, aggressively-exploited metallic mineral resources;Totally biocompatible with no cytotoxicity;200 times lower GHG emissions during production for the same amount of antimicrobial active principle;

Solution on-sentence summary: Deodorization and decontamination unit with energy recovery for factories
Identification: The solution aims helping out industries that desire a more energy efficient and environmentally friendly process. Airec’odor is designed to be the efficient solution to treat atmospheric pollution and participate in a “zero carbon” economy. As various industrials need to comply with local restrictions and respect the wellbeing of nearby citizens, Clauger decided to create the Airec’odor to get rid of pollutants and smell annoyance emitted by factories while also recovering raw material and energy. The solution allows to maintain the economic activity of industrial sites in urban areas. Airec’odor is a customizable solution that can include: optimized odour control and treatment + energy recovery + atmospheric emission treatment + process material re-use + performance commitment contract.
