Solution on-sentence summary: Replacing diesel or gasoline generators with an emission-free, silent, low cost power source
Identification: The world needs off-grid power. There are still 1.3 billion people in the world without electricity access. Most off-grid power for critical infrastructure comes from diesel or gasoline generators. Can you imagine eliminating the pollution and noise and reducing the carbon footprint and cost of electricity from these generators without sacrificing their flexibility? SIQENS is now entering the multi-billion-dollar generator industry with a power source that reduces fuel costs by up to 70% and emissions by 99%. SIQENS has created a plug and play battery charger based on its methanol fuel cell technology. The internationally patented technology called ‘4CycleTec’ transforms methanol to hydrogen by recycling all energy and media flows (heat, fuel, water, and catalyst electrolyte). It improves efficiency and durability and reduces purchase and operation costs.

Solution on-sentence summary: An eco-innovative and cost-effective extrusion technology for reducing deforestation and biodiversity loss
Identification: The first issue is that of mixed plastic waste. According to Plastics Europe, in 2018, 19.6 million tons of post-consumer waste plastics were landfilled or incinerated, as they could not be easily collected, separated and recycled. The second issue is the substitution of plywood, a key high volume commodity in construction industry formworks that is generating a very negative deforestation effect. To tackle these challenges, ECOSHEET-PRO’s extrusion lines transform mixed plastic into a competitive, reusable, plywood replacement, cutting down global demand for plywood and contributing to a substantial reduction in deforestation and biodiversity loss.

Solution on-sentence summary: A globally preeminent lithium-ion battery resource recovery technology
Identification: Traditionally, when li-ion batteries have reached the end of life, they have predominantly been treated as waste and landfilled, or partially recycled through pyro-metallurgical processes, which have average recovery rates of 40%. However, these methods are inefficient and can lead to environmental contamination, safety hazards at general recycling plants and otherwise dampen the environmentally friendly vision of electrification. Li-Cycle Technology™ aims at recycling all types of lithium-ion batteries used in electronic devices, electric vehicles and energy storage. It can do so with an unparalleled recovery rate of over 95% of all materials. The company’s industry-leading processing technologies uniquely position it to be a key player in supporting the growing international movement towards zero-carbon technologies and the creation of a circular economy for lithium-ion batteries.

Solution on-sentence summary: A cryogenic liquefaction solution to temporarily store excess biomethane production from AD plants.
Identification:
Azola BIO aims to tackle the following problems: -Loss of income impacting biomethane injection projects due to seasonal/recurrent low gas demand periods -Lost biomethane injected into gas distribution networks due to flared production as a response to congestion occurrences. -Lack of profitability for certain remote methanization projects that cannot be connected to a nearby network mesh. 

Azola developed a modular, no rotary machinery and low CAPEX solution for biomethane producers that comes with an integrated polishing, liquefaction-cryogenic storage, vaporization-reinjection, and plant control solution. The process uses an open cycle of liquid nitrogen for liquefaction, and where nitrogen is further valorised to regenerate the polishing unit's adsorption columns. The reinjection module uses a pressure build up PBU system, to vaporize and reinject the stored liquid biomethane into the grid. The whole process is automated for start-up and shutdown and could be remotely controlled and operated.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

Solution on-sentence summary: A solution to assess fugitive ghg emissions from landfill operations
Identification: Tracking, monitoring and quantifying emissions has never been more important. Mainstream methodology for quantifying and reporting emissions uses theoretical factors and does not localize hot spots of emissions. At a national scale, these fluctuations can be smoothed, but at a local scale, this reporting could give highly inaccurate results. Quick Scan Service addresses this issue by assessing emissions and proposing optimal solutions to cut emissions. This Solution allows users to measure their mitigation impact and sell carbon credits on the market. This Solution can be applied to various clients anywhere in the world, including waste management operators, wastewater operators and industrial operators.
Looking For: Network, new clients, visibility, credibility
Tags: Carbon emissions waste, Service, Industrial Waste, Sensors & monitoring
Sectors: Waste/Pollution, Industry/Goods, Fumes and waste-heat managementEcosystems management

The Financial benefits: Payback in under 3 years;

Solution on-sentence summary: Facilitating last mile delivery using cargo e-scooter that can transform into a trolley
Identification: MIMO C1 features a customizable front cargo space that takes up to 70kg of additional load and a quick-folding mechanism. On-the-go battery swapping allows MIMO C1 users to commute longer and further. Smaller than a bicycle, MIMO C1 is easier to handle and more affordable than cargo bicycles. What makes MIMO C1 unique is the practical combination of the mobility of an e-scooter and the convenience of a push trolley so users will never have to leave their mobility device to make a collection or delivery. MIMO C1 is an all-in-one solution for first to last mile delivery.

Solution on-sentence summary: A one-time application offering an alternative to chemical solvent use in construction
Identification: The construction industry uses moulds, also called formwork, to pour concrete and form a structure. These moulds are traditionally made from wood, which requires the use of toxic chemical solvents to stop the concrete sticking to the mould. NanoPhyll's SuRelease™ nano950 presents a sustainable solution to this problem. The Solution is single-application, reusable nanocomposite polymer top coat which can be used on a range of materials, including steel, aluminium, wood, PVC, HDPE, rubber and concrete substrates. SuRelease™ nano950 has excellent properties in strength, durability, anti-abrasion, corrosion, antibacterial, antifungal, and weather resistance. SuRelease™ nano950 is specially designed to withstand high abrasion and to use as a permanent release agent for formwork. By embracing this Solution, the construction agency can save time, reduce material use and increase the sustainability of their operations.
Looking For: Network, new clients, visibility, funding, partners
Tags: Concrete, Industrial coating, Nanotechnologies, Cement, Chemicals alternatives, Construction materials

Solution on-sentence summary: A programmable smart light solution using sunlight's full spectrum
Identification: Horticultural lighting systems are designed the same way lighting has been designed for over a hundred years: they consume a lot of electricity, have a short lifespan, emit pollutants, produce a fixed spectrum, aren’t programmable and lack integrated connectivity. Sollum Technologies addresses these challenges thanks to its programmable smart lighting solution that combines a programmable LED light fixture which recreates and/or compensates the full spectrum of the sun's natural light with a cloud-based platform predicated on intelligent algorithms that command and control the fixtures. Sollum’s simple and user-friendly SUN as a Service™ application enables greenhouse producers to program, adjust and modulate light fixtures according to their specific needs remotely and in real time to create optimal lighting conditions. The solution increases the productivity of greenhouse cultivation while improving quality and taste and reducing energy consumption.
Looking For: Funding, Partners, Visibility
Tags: Greenhouse, LED, Indoor farming, Agricultural equipment & machinery

Solution on-sentence summary: Double-combustion wood pellet outdoor heaters
Identification: Showcasing bars and restaurants, terraces are the first contact with customers, pushing them to sit down or leave. It is also an additional sales space that must be optimized by offering comfort to customers. For these two reasons, the development and installation of heating systems for terraces have exploded in recent years. However, today's heating systems are veritable energy chasms and emit a significant amount of CO2. To meet this challenge, Edelsun offers an alternative by using wood pellets as fuel to provide a local, renewable and CO2 neutral heating system. Thanks to its design allowing the customer to admire the beautiful flames, Edelsun's product can quickly become a competitive advantage, attracting customers while keeping them warm at a lower environmental cost. Its specific double combustion technology generates 5 hours of heat with only 10 kg of pellets while producing only 40 grams of ash.

Solution name: Buy Back Program for Mobile Devices
Solution on-sentence summary: Back2Buzz incentives customers to trade in their old mobile devices, to refurbish them and give them an extended life
Identification: 80% of the total smartphone volume sold is estimated to remain in drawers (hibernating). Back2Buzz incentives customers to trade in their old mobile devices, to refurbish them and give them an extended life. By using a widget, an app, and a solid back system, Back2Buzz can give higher residual values for a trade-in device than the competition making it more interesting for a customer to trade in older devices. By refurbishing mobile devices, the life cycle of a mobile device is extended by at least 24 months. At the end of the full life cycle (which can be up to 6 years), Back2Buzz makes sure that those devices are recovered and recycled correctly, meaning that the batterie is recycled by official instances (Bebat) and that other precious elements (gold, silver, copper) are recovered from other components.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding
Tags: Recycled, Electronic waste, Rare earths, Waste collection, Logistics, Reuse waste, Recycle waste

The Financial benefits: A higher residual value is economically more interesting for a customer to trade-in a old mobile device than to keep it in a drawer;A well kept mobile device can be given a second and even a third life, extending the life cycle of a mobile device from 23 months average up to 6 years;

Solution on-sentence summary: A shallow geothermal solution delivering carbon-free heat to residential customers and businesses
Identification: Seeking to achieve a successful transition to cleaner energy systems, targeo provides to heat transition players/local utilities/Stadtwerke a regional analysis to identify the best potential geothermal clients in their region outside their current customer base. It allows to address this client in groups and make campaign installations to leverage scaling effects. It also gives an overview of CO2 emission in their region, per building, and a way forward to decrease them. This solution relies on the process of data about the underground and geothermal potential, the characteristics of buildings and their demand, and the existing infrastructures; thanks to a precise GIS approach. In addition, targeo works as a geothermal expert office realizing all the subsurface infrastructure turn-key in a contracting model including planning, permitting, drilling and operation.

Solution on-sentence summary: Floating solar system enabling affordable clean energy
Identification: One of the limiting factors to deploy widely solar power plants is the lack of suitable land area. Floating solar is a relatively new technology. Ocean Suns has developed a novel solution to floating solar based on rigid solar modules mounted on hydro-elastic membranes. Designed for minimal use of materials, the solution is efficient at a lower cost. The lean floater design reduces wind drag and the hydro-elastic properties provide excellent seaworthiness. Extensive use of recyclable polymer materials reduces problems with corrosion and fatigue. Consequently, the Ocean Sun solution enables floating solar to a larger geographical area. It is not limited to rivers, lakes and reservoirs, but also nearshore and offshore deployment. The resulting cost of energy is lowered to an unprecedented level

Solution on-sentence summary: A whole-home smart water system for real time water management and early leak detection
Identification: The Intellecy BluView is a smart water system that provides two major benefits: 1) saving water by managing water use in real-time and the reduction of wasted water and 2) leak protection by providing complete leak detection coverage of the structure and remote water shut-off. BluView is a smart home/IoT system using a highly reliable static, non-intrusive sensor and machine learning technology to monitor and measure water flow in realtime. BluView detects water leaks, big or small, anywhere in a home or building. It can help minimize damage by enabling the user to shut off their water remotely from their smartphone or from the web-based dashboard. Our machine learning helps the user know their normal usage patterns, set conservation goals and track their savings. BluView alerts the user of abnormal high use to prevent water bill surprises.

Solution on-sentence summary: A solution for providing electricity to undeveloped areas having some water stream resources
Identification: This solution, named by Floating Drum Turbine or FDT, provides distributed generation of hydroelectricity from the water streams (canals/rivers) using an innovative micro-turbine which is registered in the WIPO-PCT system. This turbine consists of an undershot waterwheel floated on a water stream using a buoyant skid, and be anchored to the water bankside using some cables or hinged arms. By the way, the water stream makes the turbine and its coupled generator to rotate which causes to generate the electricity. This solution provides steady electricity generation (365 days, 24 hours) with constant efficiency.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

Solution on-sentence summary: The use of biomethane as truck fuel: a circular economy
Identification:
The solution aims is to develop biomethane as truck fuel. Carrefour designed a biomethane ecosystem, by setting up patnerships with gas industrials, car manufacturers and transport companies. The goal is to gathered every actors of biomethane chain and lead them toward a common goal : developping biomethane trucks instead of diesel. Gas industrials developped biogas stations. Car's manufacturers engineer biogas trucks, and transport companies purchased those trucks. Carrefour's role is to garantee, negociate and support each link of biomethane ecosystem, in order to reduce its carbon footprint, anticipate regulation and innovate.

The development of biomethane allow to reduce by 75% CO2 emissions and remote small particulates emission (on same distance as diesel). Biogas also have an impact on traffic noise and reduced by 50% this nuisance.

Biomethane relies on circular economy, as it is made from organic waste: like agricultural waste or Carrefour shop's organic waste.

Solution on-sentence summary: A peat substitute for use as casing soil in the mushroom industry
Identification: The company has developed a patented process that can produce the products TEFA and BABS from corn straw residues. TEFA is a full-fledged peat substitute and is ideal as a structural material in plant substrates as well as cover soil for mushroom cultivation. By replacing peat with TEFA , the CO2 emissions associated with peat consumption are reduced by 85%, ecologically valuable peatlands are spared and the transport routes to end-customers are shortened. BABS has similar characteristics as charcoal, polystyrene or superabsorber polymers. The unique properties of the material enable new applications in the areas of plant substrates (extension of casting intervals), buildings insulation and exhaust air purification (removal of ammonia from animal husbandry).

Solution on-sentence summary: A solution to urban mobility challenges in africa
Identification: Access to transport and energy are often the main concerns faced by communities across Africa. With a lack of access to vital services, opportunities to reach markets, business areas, educational and health facilities become limited, and there's a pressing need for more affordable, effective and sustainable alternatives. In peri-urban areas in Namibia, people spend up to 1/3 of their disposal income on mobility needs. Mobility in the delivery industry is dominated by fuel-driven motorbikes (125cc), causing pollution, congestion and health risks. With e-mobility booming globally and Africa being the ideal continent for solar energy, Ebikes4Africa introduced electric two-wheelers, solar recharge stations and customised container hubs as a solution to communal needs. E-bicycles and e-scooters are designed to meet the challenging conditions of African environments and provide reliability at an affordable price, while an open-source approach facilitates self-service and maintenance. In addition, E-Hubs – modified shipping containers fitted with solar recharge and e-bikes – provide modular solutions to communities. The Hubs include an efficient DC/DC solar recharge system to charge a variety of Li-Ion batteries, which can be swapped to eliminate the inconvenience of waiting for the battery to charge. E-Hubs offer an easy to install, turn-key ready unit, also for remote or unserviced settlements.

Solution on-sentence summary: Food waste monitoring system for commercial kitchens
Identification: Food waste has also a huge environmental impact, knowing the carbon, water, chemical and land footprint of agriculture. From an economic perspective, the BCG estimates that this global food waste issue is worth $1.2 trillion but represents in the other hand a $700 billion opportunity. Misunderstanding about the financial/social/environmental impacts of food waste by food professionals explains why so much is still wasted, and this misunderstanding is intrinsically linked to a lack of tracking. A cost-effective food waste monitoring system, helping to answer the key questions pertaining to this issue (how much is wasted, when, where, what it is, why, and how much it costs), will help overcome this . This newly available information is the knowledge needed to bring change in operations.

Solution on-sentence summary: A versatile drone designed to monitor air quality
Identification: Air quality has become an issue worldwide, most importantly because of the harm it causes to people, but also because of regulations which demand companies worldwide to abide to air quality emission standards. The goal for this solution is to help companies operating in harsh terrains to be able to monitor the air quality in the area of operations, thus being able abide to these laws. The solution: the Andean Drone, a drone aimed towards mining companies operating in harsh conditions, named after the Andes mountains in Peru. This drone is capable of flying in altitudes up to 5000 meters above sea level, wind velocities of up to 30 km/h, resistant to rain and extreme climates. This drone is adequate for working in the harsh conditions where mining operations usually take place. It carries a load which monitors the concentration of particulate matter and pollutant gasses. The collected data is then transformed into a real time contamination map.

Solution on-sentence summary: Aircrafts engine performance optimization making flying smarter and greener
Identification: DECISIONX technology could save up to 1% emissions from commercial aviation, which currently accounts for 2% of global emissions. Periodic engine washing to remove contaminants like dust, sea salt and air pollution increases gas turbine fuel efficiency and service life, so less fuel is required to generate the same thrust compared to before the wash. SATAVIA's DECISIONX technology takes into account the history of each individual aircraft, correlates this data with global environmental contaminant modelling and predicts the rate of contaminant damage to the engine, and provides bespoke washing recommendations tailored to each engine. Maintenance recommendations can be prioritised based on historical or planned flight operations. The platform is scalable to calculate exposures for a single aircraft, a fleet of aircraft, or eventually, global aircraft operations.

Solution on-sentence summary: Low barrier tool to collect empty spaces in cities where trees can be planted
Identification: This can be solved by efficiently collecting data of empty places in cities where trees can be planted. For local governments this information is much needed but very hard and time consuming to collect. By making locals point out the places where trees can be planted (or where other green infrastructure can be built) they can do it more efficiently for a fraction of the costs. This is very positive and gives the local a chance to influence their neighbourhood to the way they want to see it. Local governments are not aware of how much empty space there is around the city or next to roads. By pointing out these places and planting trees where they can, locals and local governments can work together to combat climate change, air pollution, flooding, urban heat-island effect, grey neighbourhoods and they can improve the mental health of the inhabitants.

Identification: Static waste bin collection schedules cause major challenges in modern societies, as it results in unnecessary environmental burden and economic loss. Waste management workers spend too much time on manual work on a daily basis, dealing with overflowing bins and citizen complaints. WasteHero provides you with an easy overview of all your containers and their fill-level, but also consists of a state-of-the-art route-planning system utilizing AI and deep neural networks for optimized dynamic collections of waste. Solution on-sentence summary: A sustainable and affordable alternative to single-use plastics
Identification: Plastic pollution has become one of our planet’s greatest environmental threats. Much plastic may be single-use, but that does not mean it is easily disposable. When discarded in landfills or in the environment, plastic can take up to a thousand years to decompose. Ecoware tackles this issue by providing 100% biodegradable and compostable packaging that negates the need for single-use plastics. Made from the waste of common agricultural crops, Ecoware has disposable tableware, packaging and medical-care products that offer an affordable and sustainable alternative to single-use plastics.

Solution on-sentence summary: All in one package that makes wastewater treatment affordable and easy
Identification: Every activity needs water for its operation. However, the resource is becoming scarce. Recycling is now a necessity. MBBR BOX packages help small & mid-size customers to save water while complying with increasingly complex discharge regulations. With its water treatment efficiency 3 times higher than current technologies, 1H2O3 offers compact and modular packages for Aquaponics, Aquaculture, Municipal and Industrial wastewater treatment. MBBR BOX water treatment packages have a footprint 66% lower than standard solutions and are delivered in only 4 months. The average cost is 20% lower compared to conventional solutions, and the system is made out of recyclable material (polypropylene). Whether for aquaponics, aquaculture, industrial or urban applications, the MBBR BOX plug & play solution saves up to 90% of water and is extremely easy to move compared to a conventional concrete solution. MBBR BOX is a highly customizable solution that will help small and medium-sized customers looking for a smarter, less expensive and cleaner solution to their water treatment needs.

Solution on-sentence summary: Predictive maintenance and precision mapping of buried pipelines against safety and environmental threats
Identification: A significant portion of pipelines across the world cannot be secured and inspected through traditional tools. In certain cases, such as for Oil & Gas pipelines, this constitutes a major safety and environmental threat for pipeline operators and local communities in close proximity. Incidents on such infrastructures can have devastating consequences as seen on several occasions. The US safety material administration estimates that in the past 6 years, in the US alone, there were over 3,300 incidents resulting in over 80 deaths and 400 injuries while causing $4bn of material damages. Pipelines transporting water are reported to have the same safety issues with an estimated 25% product loss due to poor infrastructure conditions. The advantage of the technology proposed by Skipper NDT is related to its ease of implementation (no disruption of operations) and its accuracy.
Looking For: New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners
Target client profile: Public Authorities, BusinessMining & Extraction, BusinessWater Utility
Tags: Water-networks, Cleaning, Maintenance and inspection
The environmental benefits: Skipper NDT could help prevent 45% of water waste during in pipelines;It could help prevent 21% of incidents responsible for the release of 325 million tons of Green House Gas worldwide;

Solution on-sentence summary: Circular led solutions reusing existing lighting features
Identification: Most lights today are designed to be thrown away after one usage, are not made to be detached and reconstructed, and are mainly made out of a mix of plastics which makes them very hard to recycle. The solution reuses waste such as fishnets to create lighting features that are made to be detached if one piece isn't working anymore which enables consumers to keep the same lighting feature for decades if wished.

Solution name: NAWACAP: High Energy High Power Ultracapacitors
Solution on-sentence summary: A new high-energy and power density ultracapacitors for energy storage
Identification:
The so-called NAWACap products are advantageous either as substitute to classic batteries and supercapacitors for application that require a short level of power providing a solution that can be 2 times smaller in size/volume/weight than existing solutions often oversize. Or it can also be stronger in hybridization to either batteries pack or Fuel cells stacks to create hybrid power supply units. 

By handling power peaks, NAWACap can significantly expand the battery life and improve safety. In an electric car for instance, an NAWACap can provide the power surge needed for acceleration, and recharge during regenerative braking (deceleration) phases. 

NAWACap is positioned in between classical ultracapacitors, where it is better in energy, and lithium batteries, where it is better in power. Our product is long-lasting (1 millions cycles), green, safe and more easily rehabilitated and recycled. NAWACap is the perfect solution for combining the power of ultracapacitors and the autonomy of a lithium battery or a fuel cell in an "hybrid system".
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: NAWA is looking for ambitious or crazy projects that can benefit from our technology which can also include unbreakable composites and advances electrodes for Lithium batteries and Fuelcells.

Solution on-sentence summary: A sustainable water saving aerator used in hand washes & sinks
Identification: In a typical American house, faucets run for around 8 minutes a day and consume nearly 11 gallons of water per person per day. That’s close to 42 liters per person every day. The water that comes out from the faucet is close to 24% of the overall water used every day. Earthfokus water savers have a unique atomization technology that converts normal flow to a fine gentle mist. The covers create a single layer of water on the surface and remove the dirt and wet the surface evenly. Plus with the fine mist, It creates a cloud around your faucet and improves your hand wash efficiency. It not only saves water but also the energies that are associated with it, Like energy and our earthfokus water saver saves more than 95% water from your tap as well as reduce your building's carbon footprint.

Solution on-sentence summary: Building a zero emission, energy consumption, energy efficient and sustainable house
Identification: Housing is energy consuming and expensive to buy and to heat. Traditional construction techniques are expensive and inefficient because they haven't reaped the benefits of industrialization, include too many stakeholders, and are not technology-oriented (12 times fewer R&D investments than any other industrial sector). Bhaluu constructions address the challenge by defining housing based on the demand’s priorities. A house is a shelter protecting its inhabitants from exterior hazards (weather, energy prices, etc.) they focus on insulation without compromising core construction features: solidity, stability, sustainability, acoustics & aesthetics. Bhaluu's technology consists of a continuous layer of self-supporting material avoiding thermal bridges which essentially blocks any exchange of temperature between the house and its environment. Combined with a construction process integrating logical steps, lean principles & automation the technology is able to provide accessible, efficient Housing. The solution product is a zero-emission housing with no concession built with industrialized processes and logical steps to gain on timing and productivity.

Solution on-sentence summary: A high-efficiency gas microchp heat pump enabling trigeneration for the residential sector
Identification: Climate change and depletion of resources are urging to create new energy models, aiming at reducing the greenhouse gas emission by reaching higher conversion rates, avoiding energy losses, and using resources of lower carbon intensity. Today, heating and cooling small businesses and residential settings represent 25% of the EU’s energy consumption. Condensing boilers and heat pumps are the main options nowadays. If heat pumps have a much better energy efficiency than condensing boilers, they are also more expensive during the initial installation and their exploitation. Indeed, heat pumps are powered with electricity coming from the grid and their efficiency is jeopardized by the higher cost of the electricity in comparison to natural gas. In addition, during wintertime, the efficiency of the heat pump significantly decreases which contributes to a significant increase of electricity consumption. Moreover, the inefficiencies of centralized production (40%) and the losses in transportation (5-10%) contribute to lower the global footprint of heat pumps. FLAMINCO merges 3 technologies in one pathway towards energy decarbonization: gas micro-CHP (Combined Heat and Power), heat pumps, and condensing boilers. It can be powered with natural gas, biogas or electricity to deliver up to 135 kWth of reliable and sustainable heat (and sometimes electricity supply) and/or 50 kW of cooling.  The technology merges cutting-edge technologies for heating sector, micro CHP, and gas heat pumps, in a versatile technology, reaching efficiencies over 175% and thus saving costs 4,600 €/yr. while reducing greenhouse gas emissions by 31%. It is ready to integrate into smart grids and it may decide how to work depending on economic and environmental factors, contributing to a more sustainable energy production
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility,
Tags: Heat-pump, Biogas & biomethane, Cooling, Biofuel, Cogeneration (heat and power), Building heating
Sectors: Buildings, Heating, cooling and ventilation, Energy and fuel efficiency

Solution on-sentence summary: A self-sufficient urban car using solar cells, fuel cell, and batteries
Identification: H2EOL provides a new solution for the city. Organized as a fleet, H2EOL could be used in town as a new public transport. If their batteries are full, the car could be plugged into the general electric system and provide energy thanks to his solar panels. In addition, H2EOL can be self-sufficient thanks to its solar panels, if it covers only 50 km per day. H2EOL is a part of a local ecosystem including green hydrogen production from water electrolysis. Hydrogen will be pressurized in caps of 1kg of H2 to supply H2EOL. The excess of hydrogen production could be used for other applications (bus, etc.). The structure of H2EOL is made out of composite materials. These materials reduce the total weight of H2EOL vehicles by 600 kg highly increasing its autonomy.

Solution on-sentence summary: A carbon-free electric generator matching diesel
Identification: Classical gensets are very noisy, require frequent maintenance, present a very bad energy efficiency (about 15% to 20% from tank to electric output) and can only be operated outdoor due to their pollutant emissions. BOXHy solution solves all these drawbacks, considering hydrogen as a fuel, and a hybridization between fuel cell and batteries, monitored by artificial intelligence, for a tailored electric power supply. As the only “pollutant” emission is water, BOXHy solution can be operated indoor & outdoor. As it is also noiseless, it is very suitable for operation is the close environment of the workers. As there are less moving parts, maintenance is dramatically reduced. Finally, energy efficiency is reaching about 55% from tank to output. In a nutshell, BOXHy solutions are the first Carbon-free Electric generators that can match fossil fuel Total Cost of Ownership, with high energy efficiency, no pollutant emissions and noise hazards.

OptiClean comes with productivity gains as well as CAPEX (CIP station capacity) and OPEX/environmental effects (water, energy). Another significant benefit comes from a strong improvement of CIP Quality management, which is key for a number of industrial activities.

Solution on-sentence summary: A fuel and emissions management tool for road freight carriers
Identification: Road freight carriers are under strong economic pressure, operating at profit margins of roughly 3%. Fuel is a major cost factor, accounting for about 30% of operating costs. The importance of reducing fuel increases with rising fuel prices, climate change and the need for shippers to reduce the environmental impact of supply chains. Yet, fuel management today often only happens at the end of the month for reporting purposes. Measures to increase fuel efficiency are missed out as they are dispersed across different fleet activities. Tracks provides road freight carriers a fuel and emissions management tool to centrally measure, reduce and report the fuel consumption and CO2 emissions of their truck fleet. With Tracks' solution, fuel efficiency measures are identified through AI-based digital twins of every truck. In a fuel efficiency hub, fleets can implement recommendations to reduce fuel consumption across fleet activities.

Solution name: Zero Emission Energy Recovery Brake System
Solution on-sentence summary: Eliminating the impact of brake wear dust on motor vehicles
Identification: Car manufacturers have been focused on exhaust emissions for decades, but the engine isn't the only thing creating air pollution on a vehicle. As they wear out, brake pads and tires, as well as the road surface itself, release particles of dust in the ambient air. Several studies in Science of The Total Environment or in the ACS journal Environmental Science & Technology have shown that automotive brake wear particles are a major source of Fine Particulate Matter (PM10) originating from motor vehicles. Specifically, brake wear dust is estimated to contribute 16-55% of non-exhaust traffic-related emissions. The impact of this pollution is catastrophic as it can cause cardio-respiratory problems or lung cancer to those who are exposed. According to EEA (European Environment Agency), air pollution kills over 500,000 Europeans a year. Based on innovative technology, it is possible to eliminate polluting conventional braking systems. To replace them, Mazap offers a solution that combines the safety of mechanics and the cleanliness of electricity, without compromising performance or safety. The result is economical and environmentally responsible.
Looking For: New clients, Visibility, Partners,
Tags: Cars, Heavy duty vehicles, Vehicles
Sectors: Freight, Mobility, Industry/Goods, Vehicles and vessels
The environmental benefits: Zero Emission : electromagnetic technology instead of mechanical friction;Energy Recovery : from kinetic to electrical, instead of turning it into heat; Long lifetime : Maintenance free of wear parts as pads;Fully eradicate Particulate Matter (PM) generation during braking phase;
The Financial benefits: Optimisation of car consumption;Final user average economy of $400 a year;

Identification: RatedPower offers pvDesign, a cloud-based global SaaS that optimizes and shortens the design and engineering process of utility-scale PV plants from an average time of 4-6 weeks to seconds. The customers use pvDesign by simply uploading the project’s location, selecting the main equipment and criteria (topography, civil, electrical, meteorological, etc.) and download all the engineering documentation required for a given project. pvDesign, by using heuristic functions, finds the smartest site configuration in terms of cost and efficiency, often not so obvious for an engineer, enabling comparisons to secure the selection of the optimum one. They are able to better manage their resources, better understand the whole project environment and getting more accurate and optimized results. By using pvDesign clients saw a decrease of 5% in the LCOE of their plants, which translates to a 20% higher solar plant profitability.

Solution on-sentence summary: A solution for optimizing energy consumption and air quality in aquatic centres
Identification: The technical operation of aquatic centres encompasses important technical and economic issues. The municipal swimming pool is the most energy-consuming building in a local community. To tackle this challenge, ELENA Piscines developed an HVAC solution for swimming pools with immediate and significant gains, thanks to the installation of a controller, compatible with the existing Air Handling Unit (AHU) and a few sensors placed in the pool hall (temperature, hygrometry, condensation). The principle is simple: The right amount of fresh air at the right time to guarantee excellent air quality (chloramine-free), optimal hygrothermal comfort, preservation of the equipment and building (humidity control), reduction of energy consumption due to air treatment (reduction of the electrical power of the air fans).

Solution on-sentence summary: An automated solution to ease natural aeration of homes & buildings for a better health
Identification: Air quality is the first cause of human deaths in the world. Interior air quality is 2 to 8 times more polluted than outside air. It is recommended by the World Health Organization to aerate 10 minutes in the morning and the evening. But very few people are doing this for various and multiple reasons. To ease the renewal of interior air in homes and buildings, the Somfy Air solution provides an automated solution which open and close windows, in a secure mode, even if you're not here. The solution has three different levels of natural aeration depending on people's wishes. The first one will open or close the window according to a manual control, the second one with sensors, and the last one can manage the interior air quality & secured aeration. The windows are at all-time secured, as a sensor detects any intrusion attempt; and of course, the opening/closure of the window is made on a secured mode.

Solution on-sentence summary: Reducing the amount of virgin wood used in the construction industry
Identification: ReWood aims at reducing the amount of virgin wood, which is being used in the construction industry, one of the top consumer of raw materials. By burning the wood slightly, it becomes resistant to humidity and can last for more than 50 years. Highly versatile, ReWood delivers a solution to architects interested in making new buildings with a nordic look while using local and sustainable materials.

Solution on-sentence summary: A unique turbine technology for the floating wind energy sector
Identification: Seawind has developed an offshore wind energy system (wind turbine and foundation) and a procedure to install the system economically offshore. Seawind assembles those systems not at sea as it is done today with the use of expensive crane vessels or jackups. The Seawind systems are assembled at a pier or at a dry dock and brought to the installation site completely assembled. In the case of floating systems, installation means simply anchoring. In the case of bottom fixed systems, installation means lowering the complete system to the seabed and actuate suction buckets. The time of installation is drastically reduced, complete systems can be stored in sheltered waters for installation during calm weather windows. The overall time for the realization of a complete offshore wind farm (500+ MW) goes down to less than one year. Foundations are made of UHPC, the lifetime of the wind farm is 50+ years, hence the system can run for many years at marginal costs, like large hydropower plants.
Looking For: New clients, Visibility, Funding, Credibility, Network, Partners,
Tags: Offshore wind power, Turbines, Wind power
Sectors: Energy, Infrastructures, Power and fuel generation

Solution on-sentence summary: A biomass cookstove giving electricity access to rural communities
Identification: About 2.6 billion people in the world do not have access to modern and clean energy which is driving a range of issues across the world including poverty, respiratory illnesses, and deforestation. The technology and know-how needed to enable energy access exists, but is currently applied in two siloed sectors: thermal energy (cookstoves) and electricity. This disparate approach has resulted in a market gap that can have serious environmental repercussions and pressure on local natural resources. The ACE One is a solution that addresses this very gap by using a solar-charged LiFePO4 battery to power the ventilator needed to create a truly clean biomass combustion while also giving users access to lighting and phone charging. Built with durable materials (8-12 years life cycle), using 50-85% less fuel, burning any type of solid biomass it is sold on a 6-9 month micro-loan. With this model, ACE is likely the only company that can give $2-a-day people access to a $100+ product.
Looking For: Network, Visibility, Partners, Credibility,
Tags: Off-grid, Developing countries, Cooker & cookstove, Solid biomass, Biofuel

Solution on-sentence summary: A solution to oxidize and disinfect industrial wastewater and reduce treatment costs
Identification: The Plasma Vortex is a state-of-the-art plasma disinfection and oxidation system that provides robust and cost-effective wastewater decontamination. This non-chemical "directed energy" system oxidizes grey and black water, destroys organic compounds, disinfects and significantly reduces the treatment costs of other industrial effluents. Thanks to its modular and highly scalable technology, Plasma Vortex reduces existing chemical treatments, offering an environmentally friendly and cost-effective alternative to incineration. Plasma is an ionized gas ("arc lightning") and non-chemical (physics-based) treatment approach. This solution reduces the energy and cost of industrial wastewater treatment. Ultimately, Vortex Plasma allows the treatment of the most contaminated streams - including aqueous effluent and sludge streams. In addition, Plasma Vortex offers significant energy, water and environmental savings compared to the existing AOP process.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

Solution on-sentence summary: Robotic mass-production of solar concentrator solutions
Identification: Industries such as food & beverages, textiles and chemicals must switch to renewable sources of fuel in the near future to reduce emissions. However, producing reliable high temperatures continues to be a barrier. However, solar thermal heat concentrators such as those produced by Absolicon now enable the production of steam and heat up to 160c from renewable sources. Absolicon's regional Robotic Production Line will mass-produce 100,000 m2 (50 MW) of the T160 parabolic solar concentrating collector every year. Thanks to the local production, the solar collectors can be locally built and installed and locally financed. This will result in solar thermal being cheaper than heat from oil and gas and in some sunny places even cheaper than coal and waste.

Solution on-sentence summary: Co2 waste mineralization as a new standard for sustainable concrete production
Identification: Cement, the main ingredient of concrete, is responsible for approximately 7% of global man-made greenhouse emissions, making it the world's second-largest industrial source of carbon dioxide. To tackle this challenge, CarbonCure Technologies developed and commercialized a scalable technology that utilizes post-industrial carbon dioxide to increase the strength of concrete, allowing for less cement in concrete mixes. Its retrofit technology chemically mineralizes waste carbon dioxide during the concrete production process, making greener and stronger concrete. The CarbonCure Technology is being used at hundreds of concrete plants today to reduce concrete’s carbon footprint (17 kilograms GHGsper cubic metre), create new production cost savings and gain a competitive advantage. CarbonCure’s vision is to make the utilization of carbon dioxide in concrete production the new standard across the globe.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Industrial additives, Carbon emissions waste, Cement, Concrete, Manufacturing, Industrial Waste, Construction materials, Waste-to-materials, Gaseous waste capture
Sectors: Industry/Goods, Waste/Pollution, Materials and chemicals, Manufacturing and construction processes, Fumes and waste-heat management
The environmental benefits: Reduces CO2 by an average of 17 kilograms per m³ thanks to a cement reduction of 5% in concrete mixes;In a typical high-rise building, savings can reach up to approximately 250,000 pounds/125 tons (120,000 kg) of CO2;
The Financial benefits: Requires no upfront capital investment;ROI within months;Since the cement is the most expensive ingredient in concrete, a reduction of 5% in the mix allows for operational efficiencies/ cost savings;

Solution on-sentence summary: Recycled insulation for the energy efficiency and circular economy of buildings
Identification: Buildings are the main contributors to greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions in Europe, generating about 36% of the EU’s total CO2 emissions throughout their entire life cycle. They account for 40% of the total energy consumption in Europe and around 461 million tons of construction and demolition waste, excluding excavation materials, are yearly generated. SICLA solution targets two of the main issues in the building sector, which are energy efficiency and recycling of construction material. SICLA meets the challenge of energy efficiency by guaranteeing at least 40% reduction in energy consumption and 34% reduction in overall construction weight. Compared with available alternatives, only 33% of the insulation thickness is required with SICLA solutions for the same thermal performance. By using more than 75 wt.% of recycled siliceous material from the demolition industry, SICLA is a smart solution to build efficiently insulated houses and at a lower environmental cost.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

Solution on-sentence summary: Connecting small scale cocoa and coffee producers with large corporate brands
Identification:
The climate crisis puts farming communities at risk, especially in tropical regions. This will have an impact on the quality and quantity of key commodities, such as coffee, cocoa, rice, medicine plants, flower, fruits, cereals, fibers. If nothing is done these crops will be difficult to produce and millions of small scale farmers' livelihoods will be deteriorated. The PUR Projet Insetting approach consists of implementing Nature Based Solutions like agroforestry within agricultural supply chains to improve the farmers' resilience to climate change while restoring degraded land. By reconnecting companies and farmers' interests, Insetting creates shared value for the planet, people and companies. The technology is provided by Nature: the tree and its multiple benefits (carbon, soil, water, biodiversity). It is enhanced with agroforestry and regenerative agriculture techniques to combine crops and tree species effectively, as well as providing carbon monitoring expertise to value carbon removed from the atmosphere by the Insetting project.

In short from a company perspective, Insetting means evaluating, reducing and offsetting its climate and environmental footprint by developing impactful socio-environmental projects within its value chain, and using them to build a sustainable society. Insetting is about harmonizing companies with Nature from within.

Solution on-sentence summary: An eco-friendly and connected mosquito control solution
Identification: For respiratory simulation, each BAM diffuses CO2 (recycled, from the fermentation of cereals) and olfactory lures in quantities similar to those of humans. The Smart BAM responds to a large-scale ecological mosquito control problem. BAM is environmentally friendly as it has no negative impact on the environment and biodiversity thanks to its species selectivity rate of 99.8%. The well-being of the citizen is ensured because there is no nuisance and danger to humans. In addition, Smart BAM also offers a sanitary tool to control and prevent the vectorial risk linked with mosquitoes (counting, identification of captured species and declaration of AI) thanks to its monitoring system. This trap meets the needs of countries where vector-borne diseases are a major political and health priority.

Solution on-sentence summary: Easy-to-install toilet structure with on-site faecal waste treatment using a bio-digester tank
Identification: Bioloos treat human waste using bacterial culture, which eliminates the need for excreta disposal, transport and treatment. The system obviates the need for external sewage infrastructure. This solution addresses the need for basic, easy-to-install and hygienic human waste disposal mechanism in areas with no infrastructural facilities, such as sewage treatment plants. In addition, it tackles the lack of cheap and easy-to-operate alternatives to traditional waste disposal systems. The bioloo reduces pathogens by 99% and reduces organic matter by 90%. For a family of 4, the bioloo recycles up to 100 litres of water, and treats 1 kg of faecal waste per day. The bioloo saves the user family/entity up to INR 2,500 (34 USD) per year as the evacuation of faecal matter is not required, and up to INR 5,000 (67USD) in operations and maintenance cost.

Solution on-sentence summary: Providing solutions for vehicle sharing and fleet management
Identification: Mobility has become one of the main challenges of the 21st century. Owning a car is getting more expensive over time and these are idle 95% of the time. In order to improve this, 10 private cars can be substituted by 1 shared car, by keeping high accessibility to the car, the experience of renting a car is equal (or better) than having it in ownership (same service, less maintenance and management time). Car Sharing reduces the number of cars and fosters electric mobility. Eccocar empowers share mobility solutions for fleet management in corporate fleets, car rental agencies and car dealers.

Solution on-sentence summary: Conversion of agricultural wastes to new material as a wood alternative
Identification: Waste harvests like agricultural straws, close to 700 million tons/year, are often burnt away if not used. Open-field burning of agricultural straws and deforestation reinforce the greenhouse effect causing global warming and climate change. XSTRAWDINARY is a simple natural fiber strawboard made from waste agricultural straws.  Fibers are bonded together under extreme heat and pressure to make a high density (as high as 1200 kg/m3) material. There is no waste and water pollution during the entire manufacturing process. 1m3 of strawboard helps cutting down 1.63 tons of CO2 emission. The material can be molded into various shapes and sizes and can be customized for different textures and colors, making it ideal for furniture, flooring, wall panels, and virtually everything from ceiling to floor, from wall to wall! One of the applications is to replace exiting wooden and plastics pallets to strawboard pallets.

Solution on-sentence summary: Business to consumer platform aiming to fight food waste
Identification: For a myriad of reasons, it’s near-impossible for food businesses to know how much surplus they will have at the end of the day, and which items they will be. All the while the issue of food waste is a great challenge in solving the climate crisis. Too Good To Go's innovative and scalable smartphone app acts as a marketplace for this surplus food and connects food suppliers with consumers willing to purchase the food in advance and collect at a specified time. This can range from bakeries that need to bake fresh every day to supermarkets that have groceries that weren’t sold and restaurants that didn’t sell all the food they had catered for that day. Since launching the app in 2016, more than 37.5M meals have been saved, representing up to 77,000 tons of CO2.

Solution on-sentence summary: Production of disposable single-use products from agri-food waste
Identification: In 2015, global plastic production was 448 million tonnes, including more than 161 million tonnes of disposable packaging, takeaway containers, plates, cutlery and cups. Only 3% of disposable tableware and takeaway food packaging is recycled, while the rest is burned and landfilled, polluting both soil and water. The Biotrem technology uses the chemical composition and physical properties of organic raw materials, waste or by-products such as wheat bran, corn bran, cassava by-products or algae to produce plates, bowls, cups, without plasticizers or other chemical compounds. By using Biotrem technology, BRANBOX goes further and offers ecological, compostable, watertight and disposable food containers. Highly scalable and customizable, the BRANBOX solution can be rapidly deployed to meet the global challenge of plastic pollution.

Solution on-sentence summary: An ozone-friendly alternative to methyl bromide
Identification: The market needs viable alternatives to conventional fumigation gases such as methyl bromide, which is being phased out globally due to its ozone-depleting substances. EDN® is an ozone-friendly alternative to methyl bromide. The advantages of EDN® include better penetration characteristics, higher efficacy and shorter application time. This Solution can be used to disinfect soil and control insects, diseases, nematodes, weeds and other parasites in a targeted manner before planting fruit, vegetables, turf and ornamental crops. It can also be used to fumigate harvested timber and logs to eliminated wood-boring insects in timber, as well as pathogens and nematodes, which present a major bio-security risk to many importing countries.

Solution on-sentence summary: Giving new life to waste products for construction and infrastructure
Identification: Vast quantities of waste are being generated across the world, and all too often no solutions are in place to reuse or recycle this waste. Rhino Machines' Solution addresses two key sources of waste: Foundry dust (an industrial waste by-product), and plastic. These two waste products are combined, mixed and processed to produce a high quality, durable and affordable brick structure, providing an alternative to the traditional 'red brick' used in construction and infrastructure. The Waste to Wealth Plastic Brick offers double the strength of a traditional brick at a lower weight and a competitive price, all whilst reducing waste.

Solution on-sentence summary: Distributed, low-cost, energy efficient technology to enrich and store biogas
Identification: More than ever there is a need for reliable, local and renewable energy solutions for agriculture. In many cases, waste from agricultural activities can be processed into biomethane or 'BioCNG' (enriched from Biogas), a high-quality clean fuel that can be used for cooking, transportation and agricultural machinery to improve the energy access. Grassroots Energy's Solution processes farm and agri waste into a low cost and sustainable biogas fuel. The Solution offers an energy efficient and modular biomethane system which can solve diverse challenges in agriculture. The Solution offers a decentralised, modular CO2 scrubbing system operating at atmospheric pressure and is three times more energy efficient than the mainstream alternative. In addition, the innovative adsorption-based cylinder storage can reduce storage pressure by three times for the same storage mass. This approach leads to reduced investments and operational challenges.

Solution on-sentence summary: Energy storage for ultra-fast EV charging and micro-grid retrofitting
Identification: Energy storage can help to avoid the need for expensive infrastructure upgrades needed to charge electric vehicles. Lithium batteries are a prime candidate as a solution in this market, however they are limited in their cycling ability, and will reach end of life rapidly when used for this purpose. Teraloop's flywheel technology (a mechanical structure used to store rotational energy) complements existing flexibility solutions to manage power and energy. Flywheels have demonstrated advantages such as high energy efficiency, high durability and high power density, making them ideal for applications requiring heavy cycling. Teraloop goes beyond the state of the art with its novel topology, enabling higher scalability to MW scale with a single device, and 5-7 times higher energy density. Teraloop's flywheel technology is ideally designed for applications such as electric vehicle ultra-fast charging, as well as micro-grid retrofitting. It further complements existing battery technologies, extending their lifetime and their sustainability.

Target client profile: Public Authorities, BusinessServicesInfrastructureRoads & Road Traffic Infrastructure

Solution on-sentence summary: A waste-to-energy solution to produce hydrogen from organic waste products
Identification: Climate change and waste are two of the greatest challenges we face. Vast quantities of municipal waste are generated every year, creating greenhouse gas emissions in the process, particularly from decaying organic waste in landfills. EEI has developed a technology that can help reduce emissions from waste and at the same time produce clean, renewable hydrogen. EEI's Eco H2® process converts organic waste into hydrogen, in doing so both reducing emissions from landfill and producing clean energy. With demand for hydrogen as a fuel source increasing, Eco H2® provides a solution to two key challenges.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Investors, partners, clients

Solution on-sentence summary: Increasing solar installed power on existing urban areas and protected architecture
Identification: The existing building stock represents 99% of a city. Integrating renewable energy sources in existing buildings can pose challenges due to technical and regulatory restrictions. SOLARBOX proposes a new renewable energy solution for existing buildings to address this challenge. SOLARBOX utilises PV technology in laminated glass to produce power from the sun whilst respecting visual regulatory requirements for old buildings. SOLARBOX is highly customisable (e.g. size, colours), making it suitable for protected buildings such as old city centres, castles, and churches to generate clean renewable energy.
Tags: Solar photovoltaic, Rooftop
Sectors: Buildings, Energy, Power and fuel generation

Solution on-sentence summary: A sustainable grass surface for amateur and high performance sports pitches
Identification: On the large market of outdoor sport pitches, there is often no alternative to synthetic turf due to the high intensity of use of these surfaces. However, synthetic turfs often are expensive, uncomfortable, and damaging for the environment. Airfibr offers an opportunity to replace  artificial pitches with natural reinforced grass. AirFibr's technology is inspired by natural soil which is stabilised and softened by the densification of lateral roots. This concept is replicated in the Airfibr technology protected by two patents. This substrate is a very fine intermixing of cork granules, silica sand and synthetic microfibers coming from recycling activities. It has numerous properties which drastically improve the resistance of natural pitches to intensive use. Airfibr helps to provide an affordable, effective and sustainable solution for sports facilities.
Looking For: Visibility, credibility, networks, new partners
Target client profile: Public Authorities, BusinessServicesEntertainment, Leisure & Art Company, BusinessServicesHotels & Resorts
Tags: Soil and land, Design, Construction materials
The environmental benefits: 72% lower energy consumption in production compared to synthetic alternative;81% lower photochemical ozone generation compared to synthetic alternative;
The Financial benefits: 30% lower investment required over a 30 year period;30% lower annual maintenance costs compared to synthetic alternative;

Solution on-sentence summary: A high-perfoming solar thermal technology for the production of hot water and steam
Identification: There is a growing demand for renewable sources of energy to replace fossil fuels for industrial processes. TVP's innovative solar thermal panel integrate patented high-vacuum technology to produce the levels of heat required for industrial processes or district heating at the same cost as natural gas and at a lower cost than liquid fossil fuels. The high-vacuum technology allows TVP's flat panels to exhibit minimal thermal losses and no degradation over time, delivering exceptional efficiency. Without the need for cleaning and only minimal maintenance, TVP’s 100% recyclable solar collectors can operate for 25 years to deliver emission free thermal energy.

Solution on-sentence summary: A reusable, refillable solution for plastic bottles and vessels
Identification: Billions of plastic bottles are used every year, creating plastic pollution on land and in water. To tackle this problem, B-CAP has created a new patented packaging solution which reduces plastic pollution and cuts carbon emissions: a filled cap with a concentrated product that can be diluted within refillable bottles. The B-CAP refill cap could replace standard products in bottles on the market. The product is simple to use for both B2B and consumers and is suitable for all kind of plastic bottle markets. By reducing the need for plastic and encouraging easy re-use, B-CAP's refillable cap can enable lower waste generation and reduced emissions.

Solution on-sentence summary: Generating electricity from the power of the ocean
Identification: Coastal and island communities are often dependent on diesel generators for power, which are a polluting and inefficient energy source. CalWave's patent-pending Wave Energy Converter (WEC) aims to address this challenge by harnessing the vastly available, predictable and stable energy from waves to provide communities with reliable, affordable and sustainable electricity and freshwater. The high performing WEC operates fully submerged, allowing it to survive stormy seas without visual impact. CalWave’s mission is to install 500 units of baseload ocean wave power by 2030 for island communities. By harnessing the power of the ocean, wave energy can provide affordable, predictable and sustainable energy for communities across the world.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Partners (public and private), early adopter clients
Tags: Coastal, Wave & Tidal power, Marine & Oceans, Hydropower

Solution on-sentence summary: A lightweight, recyclable packaging solution for multi-usage handling and logistics
Identification: Komebac® is a lightweight, 100 % recyclable packaging solution designed for multiple uses in logistics. The box is made of expanded polypropylene, offering the same functionality as a standard plastic box used for rotation packaging application but with a longer life time and a significantly lower weight (-60%). This weight reduction results in less raw material use, lower emissions and costs for transport, and benefits for operator health (less weight load resulting in less risk of injury). Extending product lifetime reduces material waste, and at the end of the product's life the material can be fully recycled. Komebac® can be used for B2B packaging used in rotation, with a lifetime of more than 10 years.

Solution on-sentence summary: A machine learning software for electric car batteries analytics
Identification: It is predicted that the future of transport will be served by on-demand autonomous EVs owned by fleets in a business model dubbed “transport-as-a-service” (TaaS), whose market size is expected to exceed $120 billion by 2025. Energsoft helps battery manufacturers by providing state of the art prediction with analytics which are up to 92-95% accurate depending on the battery chemistry and the number of batteries for ML models. Solution on-sentence summary: A multi-material manufacturing process for the mass-production of 3d components
Identification: The materials and components manufacturing sector faces a significant challenge: to combine increasing complexity of advanced materials and concepts, with sustainable, cost-effective production at scale. Existing solutions require multiple steps, driving up production time, resource usage and waste as well as costs. Reliefed Technologies is bridging the gap between design concepts and efficient serial 3D production, with its patented z.trusion® technology. This innovative Solution enables 3D solutions in existing materials production by upgrading conventional systems to allow for greater design freedom and an efficient way to produce next generation products, components, applications or systems. The technology is fully compatible with existing infrastructure for all extrudable materials.

Solution on-sentence summary: The solution for clean, quiet and safe facility management operations
Identification: The Cobrane A1 solution addresses four key challenges for facility management technicians. Firstly, it provides 100% electric mobility, reducing on-site emissions. Secondly, it provides safe and secure transport, with a speed restricted to 15 km / h. Thirdly, it delivers increased productivity through more efficient outdoor / indoor mobility. Finally, this Solution allows less arduous work for technicians while carrying their tools and equipment for them. The Cobrane A1 solution has 30 km of autonomy, can carry 100 kg on its platform, tow 200 kg on a trailer and can pass through all the doors with its width of 65 cm. All this is achieved without emitting any harmful particles, without making noise and in great safety of use.

Solution on-sentence summary: Predictable and balanced renewable energy from tides and rivers
Identification: Renewables have grown rapidly in recent year, but in many cases intermittency of supply remains an issue. Tidal energy offers a solution to this by providing a dependable power source that can support and enhance existing green energy solutions. Tocardo's tidal turbine Solution makes use of the tides and river streams to propel blades and offer customers local, predictable and balanced power generation. With the worldwide tidal market potential being 500 GW, tidal power innovations such as this Solution hold huge environmental and economic potential.

Solution on-sentence summary: Converting agricultural waste to plant-based alternatives replacing fossil-based plastics
Identification:
Nearly all of the plastic that has ever been made still exists today, much of it finding its way into nature. PlasticFri is a GreenTech company from Sweden with the vision to end plastic pollution catastrophe. Conventional plastics are made from petroleum and stay in the environment up to 1000 years!

By 2050, the oceans could have more plastic than fish.

PlasticFri is on a mission to change that by transforming renewable resources to bio-based products for replacing disposable plastics. This revolutionary technology is already tested, validated and certified by the toughest certification standards in Europe. For its groundbreaking work, the company was awarded as the “World’s Most Innovative Sustainability Startup” among 1400 companies worldwide!

PlasticFri has also been awarded the prestigious “Startup Company of the Year in Sweden" as well as named “Most promising Impact company in Nordics and Baltics"

Solution on-sentence summary: A range of composite materials for high volume automotive applications
Identification: Traditional composite materials used in the automotive industry require legnthy processing in pressure vessels to create 'cured' structures. The SolvaLite™ range of composite materials overcomes this to allow rapid manufacturing of lightweight structures for the automotive and ground-transport industries. By curing very rapidly, the composites can be used to make components measured in tens - or even hundreds - of thousands of parts per year. This is contrast to traditional composite technologies that are more suited to mere hundreds of parts per year. Through the industrialisation of these composite technologies, car manufacturers can significantly reduce the weight of their vehicles - with a positive effect on emissions of CO2 and particulates. Novel vehicle architectures and concepts are also enabled - increasing the range of choice for end consumers.
Looking For: Looking to promote SolvaLite™ to automotive OEMs as a proven efficient solution for automotive primary and secondary structural applications; Develop the supply chain to present an overall parts-manufacturing capability considered viable for high-volume automotive programs.
Tags: Lightweight, Vehicles, Carbon fiber material, Composites, Industrial materials
The environmental benefits: Enables lightweight structures that can save up to 2000kg of CO2 compared to mainstream alternative over vehicle lifetime;Up to 70% lighter than steel structures;
The Financial benefits: Faster cycle times lead to part-cost reductions of up to 75% compared with those traditional carbon-fiber composites;Enables reduced investment needs for new vehicle structures by over 75% compared with metallic incumbents;Lighter vehicles lead to reduced emissions, helping manufacturers meet vehicle emission standards;

Solution on-sentence summary: Closed-loop rare earths recycling process for hybrid and electric vehicles
Identification: Rare earth elements (REE) are targeted as a crucial component of "green technology" applications. Currently, it is forecasted an increasing demand of REE, mainly for neodymium-based permanent magnets used in highly effective motors for hybrid vehicles and wind turbine generators. The REE supply is however at risk due to the unpredictable trading policies. The REE4EU technology seeks to cover the European demand for REE using secondary REE-containing resources (i.e. from waste) currently available in Europe, thus realising an innovative closed-loop REE recycling process where REE-containing wastes are converted into REE-final products. The REE final products manufactured with recycled material showed the same properties as those made from virgin materials. Not only does REE4EU reduce landfill, but it also has far lower CO2 emissions than extracting and using virgin materials. Moreover, it also highlights competitive costs compared to the conventional scenario of primary REE extraction. The REE4EU technology can secure important value chains in Europe necessary for decarbonisation, resource efficiency and zero waste targets and gives a promising market opportunity for a European REE recycling business.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Credibility, visibility, investment

Sectors: Industry/Goods, Waste/Pollution, Materials and chemicals, Manufacturing and construction processes, Solid waste management
The environmental benefits: Around 50% lower GHG emissions compared to use of virgin REE materials;Around 35% lower primary energy consumption than mainstream alternative;

Solution on-sentence summary: Empowering renewable energy project developers through the assessment of decentralized energy resources and production systems
Identification: Decentralized energy resources (DER) and renewable energy production installations are much more profitable when coupled to energy storage systems and other flexible loads. These hybrid systems allow revenue stacking on new energy markets whilst reducing emissions and costs and increasing energy security. A challenge however remains in the complexity of the assessment of such systems. Due to their lack of awareness and skills, commercial and industrial energy consumers struggle to find appropriate partners or stuck in an intricate procedure with too many different actors (engineering consultancy, contractors, operators, etc.). This results in losing time and transparency and leads to a less profitable solution as each actor tends to sell their off-the-shelf solution or expertise. Optiwize® is a data-driven AI web solution providing decision makers in commercial and industrial sites autonomous guidance to analyse, implement and control optimal onsite renewable energy generation and storage installations. Assembling global measurement data of site energy consumption, meteorological conditions, GHG emissions, energy prices and other financial information, Optiwize® detects the most suitable investments in new and clean energy technologies and maintains maximum profitability of the achieved installation on real time by calculating optimal setpoints in line with the organisation's ecological and economical targets. In doing so, Optiwize® provides an efficient, profitable and sustainable solution for on-site energy use and storage.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Tags: Algorithms & AI, Planning tool, Software, Electrical grid
Sectors: Energy, Project planning, Power and fuel distribution
The environmental benefits: Up to 20% CO2 emissions reduction compared to non optimal achieved installations;Up to 30% CO2 emissions reduction compared to no installation;
The Financial benefits: Up to 30% energy cost reduction, up to 20% new revenues on energy markets;Return on Investment in 1-2 years;

Solution on-sentence summary: An efficient air filtration solution to ensure good air quality while reducing waste
Identification: Many companies and consumers use low cost air filtration systems reliant on disposable filters. This not only creates large quantities of waste, but also creates more work and costs for companies, with staff having to order and manage stock and frequently replace and dispose of air filters. The washable PRP3 Interfiltre air filter seeks to solve this problem by providing a long-life product which delivers clean air without the waste. The PRP3 filter can be rewashed and has a 10 year life span. The filter is easy to clean and can be washed as frequently as necessary. All that is required is a small quantity of water to wash the filter, leaving no waste. The PRP3 filter offers an economical and efficient solution for buildings and factories to reduce waste and deliver clean air.

Solution on-sentence summary: A platform to help private gardeners to create bio-inspired landscapes
Identification: Whereas people want to buy and eat bioproducts, more than 6000 tons per year of pesticides are still used in private gardens in Switzerland and France. The COP21 and the transition law of 2018 banned the use of pesticides by private garden owners. However, no strategy has been suggested to replace the use of these pesticides so far. To meet this challenge, Greenastic aims to help people grow pesticide free’s gardens. Greenastic is a platform offering tools and services. With the GreenApp, an application based on algorithms reproducing natural associations, customers will be able to create a personalized and pesticide-free garden in less than 10 minutes. In addition, the landscaper’s service uses pictures to create personalized architectural’s plans based on customer's needs and wishes. Thanks to Greenastic, private garden owners can reduce their water consumption related to gardening by 60%, while optimizing their production thanks to plant synergies suggestions. Highly versatile, Greenastic is a solution for any gardener who wants to grows his/her own bio garden. From beginner to professional, each gardener will find a suitable solution on the Greenastic platform.

Tags: Gardening, Planning tool, Irrigation, Smart-buildings

Solution on-sentence summary: A sustainable and efficient solution for cooling data centres
Identification: Data centres require frequent cooling to maintain operation, leading to high energy use and emissions. Immersion4's innovative synthetic liquid coolant solution captures waste heat from data systems without the need for additional external sourcing of cooling. The coolant absorbs heat given off by the data system, allowing the system to continue to operate efficiently. Data systems are fully protected, with no corrosion or oxidation taking place. Customers benefit from a massively reduced cooling energy bill, lower acquisition costs, space savings, and a resilient and reliable system.

Solution on-sentence summary: Energy conservation, storage and demand response, delivered as a service
Identification: Companies are faced with a growing demand to become carbon neutral, which involves greater efficiency and the electrification of processes which are dependent on fossil fuels. The transition towards electrification creates a number of challenges, including higher costs, and the fluctuating availability of renewable electricity. GridManager II delivers a solution to these challenges. GridManager II offers a Smart Grid solution involving energy storage and demand response to better manage energy consumption. Implementing this solution with Carlsberg in Denmark is allowing cooling and storage to become batteries for green power, reducing ventilation costs and indeed the total cost of ownership for a power-based system. By lowering costs and cutting energy consumption, this solution offers a profitable way to transition to carbon neutrality.
Looking For: Network, new clients, visibility, funding, partners, credibility
Tags: Electrical grid, Smart-grid, Software, Smart-buildings
Sectors: Energy, Buildings, Power and fuel distributionEnergy storage, Energy and fuel efficiency
The environmental benefits: Energy consumption and emissions can be reduced by up to 50%;Drastically increases the use of renewables in companies' energy consumption;
The Financial benefits: Can reduce client costs by around 20%;Payback time for clients is less than 1 year;
Complementary solutions:

 (Buildings & Shelters);

Solution on-sentence summary: Scalable waste water treatment for the oil and gas industry
Identification: Industry accounts for almost the 30% of global water demand. Improper treatment of this water can lead to environmental and human health problems. MagnetoSponges aims to provide a competitive, environmentally sustainable and scalable waste water treatment solution. MagnetoSponges are micron-aggregates of magnetic functionalised nanoparticles between 10 and 50 nm. This gives to the technology advantages both in terms of extremely high surface area of nanomaterial (high efficiency), and in terms of easy removal of micro-material. The use of this technology enables water to be recycled directly on site; sharply reduces the amount of space needed for purification infrastructure; and is suitable for use on-site, as a turn-key service, or even in mobile water-treatment plants. This delivers clear environmental and financial benefits for industrial companies. MagnetoSponges can also be used for gas stream treatment and purification to reduce the presence of volatile organic compounds (VOCs).
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: End users that can be partners to develop pilot tests. This will help to validate the technology in different sectors and to obtain a series of successful case studies to enhance the Solution's credibility.
Target client profile: BusinessManufacturingFood Products, BusinessManufacturingTextiles & Clothes, BusinessWater Utility, BusinessManufacturingMetals & Steel
Tags: Nanotechnologies
The environmental benefits: Up to 30% reduction in energy consumption compared to mainstream alternative;Presents opportunity to re-use water in factories without internal waste water treatment plants;
The Financial benefits: Up to 40% cost saving for treatment on-site compared to disposing the waste through external providers;Up to 30% saving for gas stream treatment by reducing volatile organic compounds (VOCs);
